문제: 1. Which of the following combination is not desirable as a driver's license when towing a 1.5-ton towed automobile using a 4.5-ton truck?
보기1: ① Class I driver’s license for large motor vehicles and for small towing vehicles
보기2: ② Class I drivers' license for ordinary motor vehicles and for large towing vehicles
보기3: ③ Class I drivers' license for ordinary motor vehicles and for small towing vehicles
보기4: ④ Class II drivers' licenses for ordinary motor vehicles and for large towing vehicles

문제: 2. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is not true about driver's license issuance?
보기1: ① Your driver’s license must be issued within 30 days after passing the driver's license examination.
보기2: ② Your driver’s license cannot be issued in English.
보기3: ③ You can issue a mobile driver’s license.
보기4: ④ You can reissue a lost driver’s license.

문제: 3. What is the validity period for an international driver's license issued by the commissioner of City/Do police agency from the date of issue?
보기1: ① 1 year
보기2: ② 2 years
보기3: ③ 3 years
보기4: ④ 4 years

문제: 4. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is a prerequisite for driving an emergency passenger vehicle with a prescribed seating capacity of no more than 15 persons?
보기1: ① Class I driver’s license for ordinary motor vehicles; 3 hours of traffic safety education
보기2: ② Class I driver’s license for special motor vehicles (large towing vehicles); 2 hours of traffic safety education
보기3: ③ Class I driver’s license for special motor vehicles (recovery vehicles); 2 hours of traffic safety education
보기4: ④ Class II driver’s license for ordinary motor vehicles; 3 hours of traffic safety education

문제: 5. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is the period of validity for a student license?
보기1: ① Six months from the date of issue
보기2: ② One year from the date of issue
보기3: ③ Two years from the date of issue
보기4: ④ Three years from the date of issue

문제: 6. Which of the criteria for imposing the conditions of a driver's license under the Road Traffic Act is not correct with regard to how a driver's license is written?
보기1: ① A
보기2: ② E
보기3: ③ G
보기4: ④ H

문제: 7. A vehicle with a total weight of 780 kg is to be towed with an 11-seater passenger vehicle. Which of the following driver’s license(s) must the driver hold?
보기1: ① Class I driver’s license for ordinary motor vehicles and for small towing vehicles
보기2: ② Class II driver’s license for ordinary motor vehicles and Class I driver’s license for small towing vehicles
보기3: ③ Class I driver’s license for ordinary motor vehicles and for recovery vehicles
보기4: ④ Class II driver’s license for ordinary motor vehicles and Class I driver’s license for recovery vehicles

문제: 8. Which TWO of the following statements about the types of vehicles that can be driven by specific types of driver's license are correct?
보기1: ① An asphalt distributor may be driven by a driver holding a Class I driver’s license for large motor vehicles.
보기2: ② A dump truck may be driven by a driver holding a Class I driver’s license for ordinary motor vehicles.
보기3: ③ A 250 cc two-wheeled vehicle may be driven by a person holding a Class II driver’s license for ordinary motor vehicles.
보기4: ④ A motorcycle may be driven by a person holding a Class II driver’s license for small motor vehicles.

문제: 9. One intends to drive a 12-seater passenger vehicle. Which of the following driver’s license types must one obtain to do so?
보기1: ① Class I driver’s license for large towing vehicles
보기2: ② Class I driver’s license for recovery vehicles
보기3: ③ Class I driver’s license for ordinary motor vehicles
보기4: ④ Class II driver’s license for ordinary motor vehicles

문제: 10. Which of the following are groups of people who can obtain a Class II driver's license for ordinary motor vehicles?
보기1: ① Those who are blind in one eye but possess visual acuity of 0.5 in the other eye
보기2: ② Those who cannot differentiate red, green, and yellow colors (color blind)
보기3: ③ Those who are 17 years old
보기4: ④ Those who are deaf

문제: 11. Which of the following is a correct definition (standard) of a Motorcycle under the Road Traffic Act?
보기1: ① Displacement of up to 50 cc; maximum rated output of up to 0.59 kilowatts
보기2: ② Displacement less than 50 cc; maximum rated output less than 0.59 kilowatts
보기3: ③ Displacement of up to 125 cc; maximum rated output of up to 11 kilowatts
보기4: ④ Displacement less than 125 cc; maximum rated output less than 11 kilowatts

문제: 12. Which of the following criteria allows one to take the Class I test for large motor vehicles under the Road Traffic Act? (Excluding experience of driving a motorcycle)
보기1: ① Those who have more than 6 months of driving experience and are 18 years old
보기2: ② Those who have more than 1 year of driving experience and are 18 years old
보기3: ③ Those who have more than 6 months of driving experience and are 19 years old
보기4: ④ Those who have more than 1 year of driving experience and are 19 years old

문제: 13. If a driver's license is acquired by false or fraudulent means and a penalty more severe than a fine is imposed, how long will the person be prohibited from acquiring a driver's license?
보기1: ① One year from the date of revocation of the illegally acquired license
보기2: ② Two years from the date of revocation of the illegally acquired license
보기3: ③ Three years from the date of revocation of the illegally acquired license
보기4: ④ Four years from the date of revocation of the illegally acquired license

문제: 14. A person who fails in the road driving test may take the test again after ( ) from the date of failure. Which of the following belongs in ( )?
보기1: ① 1 day
보기2: ② 3 days
보기3: ③ 5 days
보기4: ④ 7 days

문제: 15. What are TWO inappropriate explanations for the 'Good Driving Mileage' system?
보기1: ① It is a system that provides practical incentives to those who comply with and practice traffic laws.
보기2: ② If a driver is slapped with a suspension order, the penalty can be deducted from the accumulated points.
보기3: ③ Those who have not paid the penalty or fine can participate in the no-violation, no-accident pledge of the mileage system.
보기4: ④ In case of causing a traffic accident or violating traffic laws during the pledge period, the person cannot take the pledge again.

문제: 16. Which of the following is NOT the correct definition of personal mobility devices that are motorcycles?
보기1: ① The ascent angle is less than 25 degrees.
보기2: ② The device must weigh less than 30 kg.
보기3: ③ The term 'bicycles, etc.' means bicycles and personal mobility devices
보기4: ④ When driving at a speed of 25 kilometers per hour or more, the motor should not operate.

문제: 17. The following are descriptions of the standards for personal mobility devices. Which of the following is correctly explained?
보기1: ① If a vehicle with a motor is operated at a speed of 30 km or more per hour, the motor must not operate.
보기2: ② It is a vehicle with a maximum rated output of 11 kilowatts or less, including an electric bicycle.
보기3: ③ It is a vehicle with a maximum rated output of 11 kilowatts or less, which weight less than 35 kilograms
보기4: ④ The weight of the vehicle should be less than 30 kg.

문제: 18. Which TWO of the following actions would cause someone to be barred from acquiring a driver's license for two years? (If given a penalty more severe than a fine)
보기1: ① Driving without a license three times
보기2: ② Applying for a driver's license test on behalf of someone else
보기3: ③ Using a vehicle to hold a person captive
보기4: ④ Having a driver's license canceled because of failure to take the regular aptitude test

문제: 19. According to the Road Traffic Safety Act and its Enforcement Decree, which of the following is NOT correct regarding a driver's license in English?
보기1: ① When driving in a country where driver's license in English is recognized, it is possible to drive without a separate notarized translation.
보기2: ② The driver's license in English can be used regardless of the length of stay in a country where driver's license in English is recognized.
보기3: ③ You should bring your driver's license in Korean, an international driver's license, and your passport in a country where driver's license in English is not recognized.
보기4: ④ It is the license wherein the content of a driver's license is written in English on the back of the driver's license.

문제: 20. Under the Road Traffic Act, a motorcycle is defined as a two-wheeled vehicle with a maximum rated output of ( ) or less when powered by electricity. Which of the following belongs in ( )?
보기1: ① 11 kilowatts
보기2: ② 9 kilowatts
보기3: ③ 5 kilowatts
보기4: ④ 0.59 kilowatts

문제: 21. Which of the following is the correct definition of “a line of curbstones” according to the Road Traffic Act?
보기1: ① A line indicating the direction of the thoroughfare for vehicles and horses
보기2: ② A line for guiding vehicles to drive in a single line through a set part of the road
보기3: ③ A line consisting of rocks or other material for distinguishing roadways from sidewalks
보기4: ④ A line indicating separate lanes

문제: 22. Which of the following is correct regarding the appropriate method of using personal mobility devices under the Road Traffic Act?
보기1: ① Driving beyond the seating capacity
보기2: ② Driving by a person 65 years of age or older who has returned their driver's license
보기3: ③ Driving by a person 13 years of age or older who has not obtained a driver's license
보기4: ④ Traversing a crosswalk while holding or walking a personal mobility device

문제: 23. According to the Road Traffic Act, at what age is a person required to apply for license renewal and aptitude test every 3 years?
보기1: ① 65 years or older
보기2: ② 70 years or older
보기3: ③ 75 years or older
보기4: ④ 80 years or older

문제: 24. The following are descriptions of the verification process for identifying individuals wishing to obtain a driver’s license according to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree. Which of the following is NOT correct?
보기1: ① If the resident registration card has been lost, identification can be performed via the confirmation of the application for the issuance of a resident registration card.
보기2: ② If an individual cannot be verified by either an identification certificate or fingerprint information, the person is not permitted to take the test.
보기3: ③ Fingerprint information may be compared and verified by an electronic method without the applicant's consent.
보기4: ④ If the applicant refuses to verify his or her own identity, the issuance of a driver’s license may be denied.

문제: 25. Which of the following government authorities provides special education to those who intend to get a license for fuel cell electric buses (FCEBs; seating capacity of 35 or more)?

보기3: ③ Korea Road Traffic Authority
보기4: ④ Korea Expressway Corporation

문제: 26. If a person who is likely to have a driver's license suspended due to a violation of traffic laws under the Road Traffic Act wants to take the recommended education regarding specific traffic safety, they should apply to ( )?
보기1: ① President of KoROAD
보기2: ② Head of the local government having jurisdiction over one's domicile
보기3: ③ Head of a driver licensing office
보기4: ④ Commissioner of a City/Do police agency

문제: 27. According to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, if a person who is blind in one eye intends to obtain a Class I driver's license for ordinary motor vehicles, his or her visual acuity of the other eye shall be at least ( ), and he or she shall have altitudinal visual range of ( ) degrees and vertical visual range of 20 degrees, and there shall be no scotoma or hemianopia within central visual range of 20 degrees. Which answer fits in ( )?
28. How often is a person between 65 and 75 years of age with a Class I driver’s license (excluding persons who have lost sight in only one eye) required to take a regular aptitude test?
보기1: ① Every 3 years

보기2: ② When they have their driver's license suspended

문제: 30. According to the High-pressure Gas Safety Control Act, which of the following is not true about safety education (special education) for drivers of fuel cell electric vehicles (FCEVs)?

보기2: ② Drivers who intend to newly drive FCEBs (seating capacity of 36 or more) are subject to take special education.

문제: 31. According to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, which of the following persons may NOT be issued with an English driver’s license?

문제: 35. According to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, a person who has received an extension of the period for renewal of a driver's license must renew and obtain a driver's license within ( ) from the date such ncause or event terminates. What belongs in the parentheses?

보기3: ③ 6 months

문제: 38. What is the standard for penalties imposed on a driver who knowingly uses a fake petroleum product as vehicle fuel?

문제: 41. Which TWO of the following items should you check before driving?

보기2: ② LPG for motor vehicles has a distinct odor.
보기3: ③ It is generally lighter than air.
보기4: ④ It has a high risk of explosion.

문제: 50. Which of the following is NOT a cause for reducing the braking force of a vehicle?

문제: 51. Which of the following is NOT correct regarding the method of driving a vehicle equipped with a driving assistance device?
보기1: ① When using a driving assistance device, check frequently whether the device is operating before driving.

보기3: ③ When releasing part or all of the driving assistance device, check whether it works.

문제: 52. Which of the following is not true about a driver-assistance system?
보기1: ① Lane Following Assist is a system designed to assist the driver in driving to stay within the lane on the road.
보기2: ② ASCC (Adaptive Smart Cruise Control) is a system that automatically adjusts the vehicle speed to maintain a safe distance from vehicles ahead.

보기4: ④ AEB (Autonomous Emergency Braking) is a system that prevents the wheels from locking up and reduces the braking distance

문제: 53. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is not true about an automated driving system?
보기1: ① The Road Traffic Act stipulates that “driving” does not include the use of an automated driving system in accordance with the original use of motor vehicles and horses.

문제: 68. Which of the following is most correct about the measures to prevent vehicles from catching fire?
보기1: ① Regularly check the condition of the wiring, fuel, and ignition of the vehicle every six months.
보기2: ② It is safe to throw cigarette butts outside the vehicle when smoking inside a moving vehicle.
보기3: ③ When storing cigarette lighters or matches inside the vehicle, make sure to store them in a drawer.
보기4: ④ In preparation for a fire, always equip the vehicle with a fire extinguisher and be fully aware of how to use it.

문제: 69. According to the Trucking Transport Business Act, the operator of a trucking transport business has to keep operation records in the tachograph for ( ). Which answer fits in ( )?

보기3: ③ 51 days
보기4: ④ 61 days

문제: 72. Under the Guarantee of Compulsory Motor Vehicle Liability Security Act, what is the punishment criterion for a car owner who fails to purchase a mandatory insurance? (When the car has not been operated)

보기2: ② A fine of up to 5 million won

보기4: ④ Up to 2 years of imprisonment or a fine of up to 20 million won

문제: 73. Under the Automobile Management Act and its Enforcement Decree, what kind of registration is required when ownership of a vehicle changes through inheritance, etc.?

보기2: ② Registration of transfer

보기2: ② Special inspection
보기3: ③ Inspection of tuning

보기2: ② Registration of rights

문제: 77. Which of the following is the appropriate permeability of visible rays through front windshield of motor vehicles (other than children’s school buses)?
보기1: ① Less than 40%
보기2: ② Less than 50%
보기3: ③ Less than 60%
보기4: ④ Less than 70%

문제: 78. What is the proper sequence of applying brakes while driving?
보기1: ① Identify hazard → make judgment → order action → apply brakes
보기2: ② Identify hazard → order action → make judgment → apply brakes
보기3: ③ Make judgment → identify hazard → order action → apply brakes
보기4: ④ Order action → identify hazard → make judgment → apply brakes

문제: 79. Which of the following is NOT a requirement for the SRS airbag attached to a vehicle?
보기1: ① Tensile strength and heat resistance at a high temperature
보기2: ② Tensile strength and heat resistance at a low temperature
보기3: ③ Rupture strength, wear resistance, flexibility
보기4: ④ Maximizing the impact energy in contact with a driver

문제: 80. Which of the following is correct about the precautions to take when getting in and out of a car?
보기1: ① When getting in or out, check to see if there is a car coming from behind.
보기2: ② Get out of the car immediately after completely opening the door.
보기3: ③ When a person exits a vehicle from the back seat, the driver should look straight forward.
보기4: ④ When leaving the driver's seat temporarily, you do not need to turn off the car's engine.

문제: 81. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following correctly connects the situation and the proper action drivers must take?
보기1: ① School zone - Honk horns to inform children of the vehicle passing by.
보기2: ② Railroad crossing - Increase speed to pass quickly when a crossing barrier is about to go down.
보기3: ③ Intersection without signals - When making a right turn, drive slowly along the right side of the road, and turn right.
보기4: ④ Night driving - Adjust the headlights to high-beam to caution drivers coming in the opposite direction.

문제: 82. Which of the following is correct about overtaking another car?
보기1: ① Inside tunnels, overtaking is allowed during the daytime, but is banned during the nighttime.
보기2: ② Drivers can overtake the car ahead either on its left or on its right once they turn on the headlights and honk the horn.
보기3: ③ Overtaking is not allowed on bridges or at intersections.
보기4: ④ Overtaking is not allowed when another motor vehicle is traveling along on the right-hand side of the motor vehicle running ahead.

문제: 83. Which of the following is not a desirable driver attitude?
보기1: ① Traffic situation is not changing; there is no need to make plans ahead.
보기2: ② Equip the vehicle with a fire extinguisher to take action immediately in case of a fire.
보기3: ③ Remove lighters and other flammable items from the vehicle.
보기4: ④ Drive courteously, especially for novice drivers.

문제: 84. Which of the following is the most appropriate driving behavior for a driver?
보기1: ① Sleep-deprived driving entails the risk of a traffic accident, so it is important to stop the car on a roadside to rest when you are drowsy.
보기2: ② Novice drivers should continuously drive in the overtaking lane on an expressway.
보기3: ③ Installing and operating a device that interferes with the functions of traffic regulation equipment.
보기4: ④ When you identify a risk to traffic safety, inform others with emergency flashers.

문제: 85. Which of the following is not a desirable driver attitude?
보기1: ① Always drive while obeying traffic rules, such as driving under the speed limit.
보기2: ② Drive on the shoulder in the event of traffic congestion.
보기3: ③ Compliance with traffic laws and regulations is a mutual commitment among drivers.
보기4: ④ Put pedestrian safety first before increasing vehicle speed.

문제: 86. If a traffic accident occurs due to a traffic violation, which of the following is the least priority regarding the driver's responsibility with regard to the case?
보기1: ① Criminal liability
보기2: ② Administrative liability
보기3: ③ Civil liability
보기4: ④ Notification liability

문제: 87. Which of the following is NOT a correct response by a driver to a traffic accident while driving on an expressway?
보기1: ① Take first-aid measures depending on the severity of a passenger's injury.
보기2: ② Allow a passenger to take a rest.
보기3: ③ Control the traffic at the rear part of the vehicle until a police officer arrives.
보기4: ④ Move to a safer place to prevent secondary accidents.

문제: 88. Which of the following actions is the correct behavior of a driver driving a passenger vehicle with an infant?
보기1: ① An adult in the passenger seat sits with an infant and wears the same seat belt.
보기2: ② A seat belt is enough for an infant sitting in the back seat; an infant safety harness is not necessary.
보기3: ③ To appease a crying infant while driving, it is OK to let the infant sit together with the driver in the driver’s seat and wear the same seatbelt.
보기4: ④ When riding with an infant, always use an infant safety harness with a seat belt fastened, regardless of the road the driver is taking.

문제: 89. Which TWO of the following are the responsibilities of a driver?
보기1: ① Stopping the vehicle if there is a risk of a traffic accident involving children.
보기2: ② Driving slowly on water puddle to avoid causing harm.
보기3: ③ Applying dark tinting since the brightness of vehicle windows is not regulated
보기4: ④ Driving at a reduced speed when pedestrians are crossing a crosswalk.

문제: 90. Which of the following are desirable behaviors when you are driving on a freeway? (Select two answers)
보기1: ① If you are drowsy or exhausted from driving, pull the vehicle over on the shoulder to take a rest or nap.
보기2: ② You can watch entertaining videos while driving.
보기3: ③ You should take a rest and ventilate the vehicle regularly to stay awake.
보기4: ④ You should constantly check for hazards along the route before departure and even while taking a rest.

문제: 91. Which of the following is the least desirable regarding a driver's preparation necessary for safe driving?
보기1: ① Control your body condition so that your attention is not diverted.
보기2: ② Wear clothes that are comfortable and suitable for driving.
보기3: ③ Prepare emergency signal tools including a red flashlight.
보기4: ④ In order to save fuel, preheat the engine by turning it on 10 minutes before departure.

문제: 92. Which TWO of the following are correct about concentration while driving?
보기1: ① Continuously chatting with a passenger during driving improves the driver's concentration.
보기2: ② It is better to remove stickers that can block the driver’s view.
보기3: ③ Concentration while driving has nothing to do with safe driving.
보기4: ④ TVs or DMBs should be installed where they can be seen only by passengers in the back seat.

문제: 93. According to the Road Traffic Act, if an infant is on board a vehicle (except for two-wheeled vehicles), using infant safety harness is required. Which of the following is the age criteria for an infant?
보기1: ① 8 or under
보기2: ② Under 8
보기3: ③ Under 6
보기4: ④ 6 or under

문제: 94. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is not true about regulations and proper operation of personal mobility devices (PMDs)?
보기1: ① The driver must turn on headlights and daytime running lights when driving at night.
보기2: ② Of the PMDs, not more than one person can drive an electric kick scooter.
보기3: ③ A personal mobility device includes self-balancing scooters, electric kick scooters, electric bicycles, electric unicycles, and mobility scooters.
보기4: ④ An electric bicycle which is powered by a motor can carry two persons.

문제: 95. Which of the following is true about wearing a seat belt before driving a vehicle (excluding two-wheeled vehicles)?
보기1: ① If the passenger is a child under 13 years old and is not wearing a seat belt, the driver will be imposed a fine of KRW 100,000.
보기2: ② If the passenger is 13 years old or above and is not wearing a seat belt, the driver will be imposed a fine of KRW 30,000.
보기3: ③ When driving on general roads, only the driver and front passenger are obligated to wear seat belts.
보기4: ④ All passengers are obligated to wear seat belts, but a child under 3 years old can be placed on the lap of the guardian.

문제: 96. Which of the following is a good driving attitude for accident prevention?
보기1: ① Using indicators to make sure the others know the driver’s path of travel
보기2: ② Frequently making sudden maneuvers and braking
보기3: ③ Driving to get through traffic as advantageously as possible for oneself
보기4: ④ Retribution for aggressive driving by other drivers

문제: 97. Which of the following actions is the least desirable for a driver?
보기1: ① Drive in accordance with the traffic flow while maintaining the designated speed.
보기2: ② If you are a novice driver, use the roadside on the expressway and do not interfere with the traffic flow.
보기3: ③ Do not have a fight with your car parked on the road.
보기4: ④ A student license holder should drive with a companion according to the law.

문제: 98. Which of the following is correct about yielding?
보기1: ① When driving slowly, move to the leftmost lane of the road to make way for other vehicles.
보기2: ② Proceed at high speed when an emergency vehicle is approaching you.
보기3: ③ At an intersection, yield to other vehicles regardless of who has the right-of-way.
보기4: ④ A vehicle running on a road with a yield sign should yield to the vehicles coming from other roads.

문제: 99. According to the Act On Promotion Of The Transportation Convenience Of Mobility Disadvantaged Persons, who among the following are NOT considered “mobility disadvantaged persons”?
보기1: ① The elderly
보기2: ② Pregnant women
보기3: ③ Persons accompanied by infants
보기4: ④ Persons with pets

문제: 100. In accordance with the Act On Promotion Of The Transportation Convenience Of Mobility Disadvantaged Persons, which of the following is not considered a “pedestrian safety facility” for the mobility disadvantaged persons?

보기2: ② Bicycle lane
보기3: ③ Transportation information facilities such as public traffic information system
보기4: ④ Traffic signal for pedestrians' right of way

문제: 101. Which of the following case requires driving at a slow speed according to the Road Traffic Act?
보기1: ① When the traffic signal at the intersection is flashing in red
보기2: ② Upon passing an intersection where traffic is not controlled and is frequent
보기3: ③ Upon passing an intersection where traffic is not controlled
보기4: ④ Upon changing lanes near an intersection

문제: 102. Which of the following is the safest method to turn left at a congested intersection?
보기1: ① Wherever possible, enter the intersection by following the vehicle ahead.
보기2: ② You may enter the intersection if the traffic light is green.
보기3: ③ Enter the intersection when there is space even if the traffic lights turn red.
보기4: ④ Do not enter the intersection even when the traffic lights signal a green arrow.

문제: 103. Which of the following is the correct method to enter an expressway?
보기1: ① Stop temporarily to check the traffic flow, then quickly enter the expressway.
보기2: ② Stop temporarily before entering the expressway and abruptly enter when there are vehicles passing on the road.
보기3: ③ Enter the expressway even if there is not much space to enter, in consideration of the vehicle behind.
보기4: ④ Use the acceleration lane, keeping a certain speed and enter the expressway when enough space is secured.

문제: 104. There is a vehicle A that is moving slowly on the right side of the expressway's main lane. In this case, what is the best method for vehicle B to enter the main lane?
보기1: ① Slowly increase the speed and enter, but make sure to do so after vehicle A passes.
보기2: ② Accelerate and enter using an empty roadside.
보기3: ③ Stop at the end of the acceleration lane and enter after vehicle A passes.
보기4: ④ Continue driving on the acceleration lane at the same speed as vehicle A.

문제: 105. Which of the following is the most appropriate driving behavior when a driver notices a child crossing the road without a guardian?
보기1: ① Repeatedly sound the horn so that the child can cross quickly.
보기2: ② Ensure the safety of the child crossing the road by moving slowly.
보기3: ③ Temporarily stop and ensure the safety of the child crossing the road.
보기4: ④ Ensure the safety of the child crossing the road by passing quickly.

문제: 106. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is the safest method to drive when entering an intersection with no traffic signals and where it is not possible to look to the left and right?
보기1: ① Drive slowly depending on the surrounding situation and pass through the intersection after checking that it is safe.
보기2: ② Enter while sounding your horn and flashing headlights, and drive slowly while passing through.
보기3: ③ Make a temporary stop to make sure that it is safe, and then pass through the intersection according to right-of-way standards.
보기4: ④ Since a vehicle entering the intersection first has priority, quickly pass through the intersection while checking the surroundings.

문제: 107. Which of the following would cause the biggest safety hazard when making a left turn at an intersection?
보기1: ① A pedestrian crossing a crosswalk on the right side of the intersection
보기2: ② A motorcycle approaching at high speed from the rear in the right roadway
보기3: ③ A passenger car making a right turn from the left side of the intersection
보기4: ④ A bicycle making a right turn from the opposite side

문제: 108. Under the Road Traffic Act, which of the following describes the safest attitude for a person driving a personal mobility device?
보기1: ① When passing on a sidewalk, drive away from pedestrians.
보기2: ② When driving after drinking alcohol, special attention is required.
보기3: ③ If there is a crosswalk and a bicycle crossing, use the bicycle crossing.
보기4: ④ When driving the device on a crosswalk, avoid pedestrians on the crosswalk.

문제: 109. Which of the following is correct regarding the traffic safety policy referred to as Safety Speed 5030?
보기1: ① Within 50km per hour on the automobile road and 30km per hour on the back road in a residential area in a city
보기2: ② Within 50km per hour on the main road in a city and 30km per hour on the back road in a residential area in a city.
보기3: ③ Within 50km per hour on the automobile road and 30km per hour in a school zone.
보기4: ④ Within 50km per hour on the main road in a city and 30km per hour on the bicycle track.

문제: 110. In which TWO of the following locations should you drive at a reduced speed?
보기1: ① An intersection without any traffic signals
보기2: ② A road with children crossing without a guardian
보기3: ③ A road where you see a blind person crossing using a white cane
보기4: ④ The start of a winding road

문제: 111. Which of the following are the proper ways to drive around a roundabout? (Select two answers)
보기1: ① Vehicles already in the roundabout have priority.
보기2: ② Enter a roundabout as quickly as possible.
보기3: ③ Turn on the hazard lights when entering a roundabout.
보기4: ④ The driving direction in a roundabout is counterclockwise.

문제: 112. Which TWO of the following statements about driving on an expressway are correct?
보기1: ① All passengers must wear seat belts on an expressway.
보기2: ② A vehicle driving on an expressway must yield to merging vehicles.
보기3: ③ When driving on an expressway, you are not obliged to yield even if an emergency vehicle approaches.
보기4: ④ A vehicle breakdown sign (including a safety tripod sign) must be carried in the vehicle.

문제: 113. Which TWO of the following descriptions are correct?
보기1: ① The road surface marking for the 'yield' instruction is indicated as a white ＂△＂ sign.
보기2: ② Cars driving in a lane with the yield mark must yield to cars driving in other lanes.
보기3: ③ On a general road, you must give a lane change signal 30 meters before you change lanes.
보기4: ④ In order to maintain a smoother traffic flow, you must narrow the distance with the car in front of you by increasing your speed.

문제: 114. Which TWO of the following statements are correct about yielding at an intersection with no traffic control?
보기1: ① If you are turning left, you must yield to vehicles going straight or turning right at the intersection.
보기2: ② If you are about to enter the intersection, you are not required to yield to any vehicles that are already inside the intersection and making a left turn.
보기3: ③ If you are about to enter the intersection, you must not yield to any vehicles that are about to enter the intersection from a narrower road.
보기4: ④ When multiple vehicles assigned the same priority are about to enter the intersection at the same time, the vehicles on the right have the right-of-way.

문제: 115. According to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, which TWO of the following are not correct regarding personal mobility devices?
보기1: ① A motor should not be running if the vehicle is run at a speed of 25km per hour or more.
보기2: ② Electric scooters, electric two-wheeled parallel vehicles, and electric boards fall under this category.
보기3: ③ It belongs to bicycles, etc.
보기4: ④ Vehicles whose motor has maximum rated output of 11 kilowatts or less including electric bicycles.

문제: 116. Which of the following drivers is most likely to cause an accident?
보기1: ① A driver focused only on driving
보기2: ② A driver with a habit of sudden starts, sudden braking, and sudden changes of lane
보기3: ③ A driver who keeps a safe distance from bicycles and two-wheeled vehicles
보기4: ④ A driver who is patient

문제: 117. Which of the following is not a desirable driver behavior?
보기1: ① A traffic officer's hand signals overrule traffic lights.
보기2: ② Stay updated with the ever-changing traffic laws and regulations.
보기3: ③ Upon identifying an emergency vehicle, immediately stop the vehicle, regardless of your location, and make way.
보기4: ④ Watch out for potholes when driving on a road where heavy rainfall is common or during the rainy season.

문제: 118. You are about to enter an uncontrolled intersection. If there is another vehicle already in the intersection making a left turn, what should you do?
보기1: ① Yield to another vehicle already in the intersection.
보기2: ② Straight traffic takes the right of way over turning traffic. Drive through.
보기3: ③ Ignore the vehicle in the intersection; check both sides and quickly drive through.
보기4: ④ If your lane is wider than that of another vehicle in the intersection, you have the right of way.

문제: 119. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is not true about the passenger capacity of PMDs?
보기1: ① An electric kick scooter can carry one person.
보기2: ② A self-balancing scooter can carry one person.
보기3: ③ An electric bicycle which is powered by a motor can carry two persons.
보기4: ④ The fine for violating the passenger capacity of PMDs is KRW 40,000.

문제: 120. Which of the following is a good attitude for a driver?
보기1: ① Respect for communication and safety
보기2: ② Giving precedence to cars over people
보기3: ③ Prioritizing their own car over others' vehicles
보기4: ④ Accidents are a product of bad luck, not unlawful driving.

문제: 121. Which of the following is considered as threshold for the state of intoxication at which a person is prohibited from driving a motor vehicle, etc. pursuant to the Road Traffic Act?
보기1: ① When the driver's blood-alcohol concentration is 0.03% or higher
보기2: ② When the driver's blood-alcohol concentration is 0.08% or higher
보기3: ③ When the driver's blood-alcohol concentration is 0.1% or higher
보기4: ④ When the driver's blood-alcohol concentration is 0.12% or higher

문제: 122. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following correctly describes the penalty imposed on a driver who cannot operate a vehicle properly because of fatigue (including drowsy driving)?
보기1: ① No penalty
보기2: ② A fine of up to KRW 100,000 or confinement
보기3: ③ A fine of up to KRW 200,000 or confinement
보기4: ④ A fine of up to KRW 300,000 or confinement

문제: 123. Fatigue affects a driver's driving performance. Which of the following correctly describes the influence of fatigue on a driver?
보기1: ① A driver's response time to stimuli in their surroundings quickens.
보기2: ② A driver's vision deteriorates and their view widens.
보기3: ③ A driver's ability to recognize objects and drive safely deteriorates.
보기4: ④ A driver's driving performance becomes more meticulous and planned.

문제: 124. Which of the following is NOT a correct explanation of the punishment criteria for drunk driving?
보기1: ① In case of the first violation, if the blood alcohol concentration is 0.2% or more, imprisonment between 2 to 5 years or a fine between 10 million and 20 million won
보기2: ② In case of refusal to measure alcohol consumption, imprisonment between 1 to 5 years or a fine between 5 million and 20 million won
보기3: ③ In case of the second violation involving blood alcohol concentration of 0.05%, imprisonment for up to 1 year or a fine of up to 5 million won
보기4: ④ If blood alcohol concentration is not less than 0.08 percent but less than 0.20 percent in the first violation, imprisonment between 1 to 2 years or a fine between 5 million and 10 million won

문제: 125. If you drive when you are tired, you will not be able to correctly sense the speed at which you are driving.Which of the following is correct about this statement?
보기1: ① On a narrow road, you will feel as if you were going slower than you actually are.
보기2: ② On roads with wide-open views, you will feel as if you were going faster than you actually are.
보기3: ③ You could underestimate the speed of a car coming towards you from far away and end up in an accident.
보기4: ④ There is no possibility of you mistaking a car stopped ahead on an expressway to be moving.

문제: 126. Which TWO of the following may affect idle running distance when driving a car?
보기1: ① Driving on a rainy day
보기2: ② Driving under the influence of alcohol
보기3: ③ Driving when the vehicle has insufficient brake fluid
보기4: ④ Driving when tired

문제: 127. Which TWO of the following statements about penalties imposed on drunk drivers are correct?
보기1: ① Fully inebriated drivers with a blood-alcohol concentration of 0.08% or higher will have their driver's license revoked and be punished in accordance with the law.
보기2: ② Those who refuse to take the alcohol breathalyzer test or have caused fatalities or injuries while driving with a blood-alcohol concentration of 0.03% or higher will have their driver's license revoked and be punished in accordance with the law.
보기3: ③ Those who are caught driving with a blood-alcohol concentration not less than 0.03 percent but less than 0.08 percent will have their driver's license suspended for 120 days and be punished in accordance with the law.
보기4: ④ In a case where the driver causes an accident for the first time resulting in physical harm while driving with a blood-alcohol concentration not less than 0.03 percent but less than 0.08 percent, his/her driver’s license is revoked.

문제: 128. Which TWO of the following statements about drunk driving are correct?
보기1: ① If you object to the result of a breath test, you can take another breath test.
보기2: ② You are not considered to have committed the crime of driving under the influence of alcohol if you make it home without causing an accident or endangering other people.
보기3: ③ According to the Road Traffic Law, construction machinery as defined under the Construction Machinery Management Act also cannot be driven after drinking.
보기4: ④ Your driver's license will be revoked if you refuse a breath test recommended by a police officer who has reason to believe that you may be under the influence of alcohol.

문제: 129. Which of the following are true about drowsy and/or fatigued driving? (Select two answers)
보기1: ① If drowsy while driving, you must consume more caffeine and change lanes more often to avoid monotonous driving.
보기2: ② Your alertness improves on roads with fewer variations and potential hazards, thus reducing the risk of drowsy driving.
보기3: ③ Avoid driving if you have taken cold medicines since they may cause drowsiness.
보기4: ④ Alcohol deactivates certain cerebral functions and increases the chance of drowsiness.

문제: 130. What penalty is a driver subjected to if they are caught by the police while driving in a physical state in which they are unable to drive normally (due to illness or fatigue)?
보기1: ① A fine
보기2: ② Suspension of the driver's license
보기3: ③ Confinement or a fine.
보기4: ④ No penalty

문제: 131. According to the Act on Special Cases Concerning the Settlement of Traffic Accidents, which of the following is correct when a driver has caused an accident after driving under the influence, resulting in human casualty?
보기1: ① The driver will be criminally charged even though the driver is covered with liability car insurance and has settled with the accident victim(s).
보기2: ② The driver will be exempt from criminal charges if he/she is covered with car insurance.
보기3: ③ The driver will be exempt from criminal charges if he/she is covered with comprehensive insurance.
보기4: ④ The driver will be exempt from criminal charges if he/she is covered with comprehensive insurance and has settled with the accident victim(s).

문제: 132. Driver A, with a blood alcohol concentration of over 0.03%, got rear-ended by driver B while waiting at a red light. What happens next?
보기1: ① Since drunk driving is a serious offense, driver A should be penalized.
보기2: ② Although driver B needs to be penalized for the accident, driver A is also penalized separately for drunk driving.
보기3: ③ Driver A is the victim in this accident and will not be subject to administrative penalties.
보기4: ④ Driver B receives no demerit points regardless of the cause or result of the accident.

문제: 133. According to the Road Traffic Act, a driver with a blood-alcohol concentration of ( ) or more is prohibited from driving. Select one of the following to fill in the brackets.
보기1: ① 0.01% or higher
보기2: ② 0.02% or higher
보기3: ③ 0.03% or higher
보기4: ④ 0.08% or higher

문제: 134. Which TWO of the following are correct descriptions with regards to fatigued driving and driving under the influence of drugs?
보기1: ① Fatigued driving is not likely to lead to falling asleep at the wheel.
보기2: ② Fatigued driving is dangerous because it leads to poor focus, judgment, and reflexes.
보기3: ③ It is punishable to drive under the influence of drugs and cause an accident resulting in injury.
보기4: ④ If your driver's license gets revoked because of a hit-and-run event while driving under the influence of drugs, it is possible to get the license back after three years.

문제: 135. Which of the following is NOT an appropriate method to prevent retaliatory driving?
보기1: ① Turn on the emergency flashers in case of emergency braking.
보기2: ② Turn off the head-beam headlights when a car approaches from the opposite direction.
보기3: ③ Turn on the high-beam headlights when driving at high speed.
보기4: ④ Wait three seconds before moving forward if the vehicle in front does not start moving right away.

문제: 136. Which of the following is NOT an appropriate way to report retaliatory driving?
보기1: ① Calling 120.
보기2: ② Calling 112.
보기3: ③ Posting a report on the “Looking for witnesses” smartphone app.
보기4: ④ Reporting the incident to the Cyber Police Agency.

문제: 137. According to the Road Traffic Act, the drivers of ( ) are prohibited from driving their motor vehicles and the like in a row or side by side without a good cause, in a manner that endangers other persons and causes danger to traffic. Anyone who violates this provision will be punished by ( ). Choose the correct pair for the parentheses.
보기1: ① self-balancing scooters - imprisonment with labor not exceeding 1 year or a fine not exceeding KRW5 million
보기2: ② two-wheeled vehicles - imprisonment with labor not exceeding 6 months or a fine not exceeding KRW3 million
보기3: ③ special-purpose vehicles - imprisonment with labor not exceeding 1 year or a fine not exceeding KRW5 million
보기4: ④ motorcycles - imprisonment with labor not exceeding 6 months or a fine not exceeding KRW 3 million

문제: 138. You may be subject to a penalty according to the Criminal Act if you overtake a vehicle over the center line or perform any retaliatory driving such as sudden braking. In this case, what is the correct punishment that will be imposed on you?
보기1: ① You will be sentenced to imprisonment up to 7 years or a fine not exceeding KRW 10 million.
보기2: ② You will be sentenced to imprisonment up to 10 years or a fine not exceeding KRW 20 million.
보기3: ③ You will be sentenced to imprisonment for a limited term of up to 1 year.
보기4: ④ You will be sentenced to imprisonment for a limited term up to 18 months.

문제: 139. Pursuant to the Criminal Act, you may be subject to penalty for retaliatory driving if you suddenly brake in front of a driver that made you angry due to an unexpected lane shift, and the truck following it consequently hits the vehicle behind you, resulting in injury of the truck driver. In this case, what is the correct punishment that will be imposed on you?
보기1: ① You will be sentenced to imprisonment for a limited term in the range of 1 year - 10 years.
보기2: ② You will be sentenced to imprisonment for a limited term in the range of 1 year - 20 years.
보기3: ③ You will be sentenced to imprisonment for a limited term in the range of 2 years - 10 years.
보기4: ④ You will be sentenced to imprisonment for a limited term in the range of 2 years - 20 years.

문제: 140. Which of the following is not subject to legal action for reckless driving under the Road Traffic Act?
보기1: ① Violating the maximum speed limit
보기2: ② Violating a prohibition of crossing the road, making a U-turn, or moving backward
보기3: ③ Cutting in a lane
보기4: ④ Honking the horn continuously

문제: 141. A driver of a motor vehicle (excluding personal mobility devices) will be punished for reckless driving if the driver threatens another driver by conducting the following acts in a repeated manner. Which of the following is NOT an example of reckless driving?

보기2: ② Violation of prohibitions on crossing, U-turns, and driving backwards
보기3: ③ Creating noise without reasonable cause
보기4: ④ Violating a designated lane of an expressway

문제: 142. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is the correct punishment against reckless driving?
보기1: ① Notice for the payment of a penalty of KRW 60,000
보기2: ② Administrative fine of KRW 30,000
보기3: ③ Imprisonment up to 6 months or a fine not exceeding KRW 2 million
보기4: ④ Imprisonment up to 1 year or a fine not exceeding KRW 5 million

문제: 143. While driving on an expressway, if a vehicle's load falls on the driving lane, which of the following is NOT a correct action by the driver?

보기3: ③ Stop the vehicle in a safe place and check the cargo loading status.
보기4: ④ Conduct retaliatory driving against a driver who dropped the cargo.

문제: 144. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following cannot be construed as reckless driving for a motorcycle (excluding PMDs)?
보기1: ① The driver repeatedly ignored traffic signal three times.
보기2: ② The driver committed successive violations of exceeding the speed limit and disobeying instructions.
보기3: ③ The driver committed successive violations of ignoring the traffic signal and crossing the center line.
보기4: ④ The driver committed successive violations of crossing the center line and the duty to protect pedestrians.

문제: 145. Which of the following statements is correct about reckless driving and retaliatory driving?
보기1: ① A motorcycle driver who generates noise without a just cause to threaten many unspecified drivers can be penalized for retaliatory driving.
보기2: ② The driver of a passenger car who drives over the center line and exceeds the speed limit repeatedly to threaten many unspecified drivers can be penalized for reckless driving.
보기3: ③ The driver of a large truck who intentionally overtakes a car and brakes suddenly can be penalized for reckless driving.
보기4: ④ A bus driver who repeatedly violates the legal way to overtake a car, increasing the risk of a traffic accident, can be penalized for retaliatory driving.

문제: 146. Causing harm to the life and safety of others by repeatedly driving over the center line or causing risk in the traffic flow are ( ) according to the Road Traffic Act. Which of the following is correct?

보기2: ② Reckless driving
보기3: ③ Violent driving
보기4: ④ Retaliatory driving

문제: 147. The driver of a motor vehicle (excluding personal mobility devices) will be punished for reckless driving if the driver threatens another driver by conducting the following acts in a repeated manner on a general road. Which of the following is NOT an example of reckless driving?

보기2: ② Driving over the centerline and violating the prohibition on sudden braking
보기3: ③ Not complying with the safe distance, violating lane changing prohibitions
보기4: ④ Improperly overtaking a car on a general road

문제: 148. The driver of a motor vehicle (excluding personal mobility devices) will be punished for reckless driving if the driver threatens another person by repeatedly engaging in a series of two or more of the following acts. Which of the following is NOT an example of reckless driving?

문제: 149. The driver of a motor vehicle (excluding personal mobility devices) will be punished for reckless driving if the driver threatens another driver by repeatedly engaging in the following acts. Which of the following is NOT an example of reckless driving?

보기4: ④ Violating the prohibition on passage, using mobile phone while driving

문제: 150. Which of the following is an act of reckless driving for which you can be penalized?

보기2: ② Violation of speed

문제: 156. A driver was arrested for committing special violence under the Criminal Act using vehicles, etc. (retaliatory driving). What is the administrative action for this person's driver's license?
보기1: ① Cancellation of driver's license
보기2: ② Suspension of driver's license for 100 days

문제: 157. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is not true about a pedestrian?

문제: 158. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is the correct behavior when yielding to enter an intersection with no traffic control?

문제: 159. Which of the following is not true about a driver's duty to protect pedestrians?
보기1: ① A fine will be imposed on the driver who fails to slow down or stop on a pedestrians-first road and obstructed the pedestrians.
보기2: ② The duty to protect pedestrians also applies to drivers driving on a place other than a road.
보기3: ③ If the driver sees pedestrians crossing in a crosswalk, he/she must come to a full stop before reaching the crosswalk.
보기4: ④ The driver must slow down when driving across a crosswalk in a school zone with no traffic light.

문제: 160. Which of the following is not true about a driver's duty to protect pedestrians?
보기1: ① If the driver sees pedestrians crossing in a crosswalk, he/she must come to a full stop before reaching the crosswalk.
보기2: ② The driver must slow down while keeping a safe distance when passing by pedestrians on a narrow road with no markings.
보기3: ③ If a crosswalk in a school zone has no traffic light, the driver has no duty to stop if there are no pedestrians crossing.
보기4: ④ The driver should not obstruct pedestrians crossing at an intersection with no traffic light.

문제: 161. When is the driver of a passenger car allowed to cross a sidewalk?
보기1: ① When entering a place other than a road
보기2: ② When entering a place other than a traffic lane
보기3: ③ When entering a place other than a safety zone
보기4: ④ When entering a place other than a crosswalk

문제: 162. When driving at 50 km/h on a city road, you find a pedestrian jaywalking. Which of the following is the most appropriate measure to take?

문제: 163. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is not true about a driver's duty to protect pedestrians?

보기2: ② If the driver sees a pedestrian jaywalking, the driver must stop the vehicle at a distance for the pedestrian to safely cross the road.
보기3: ③ If the driver is driving on a road with no center line and where the roadway and sidewalk are not distinguishable, the driver must slow down or stop for pedestrians to travel safely.

문제: 164. According to the Road Traffic Act, a child under the age of 13 should wear protective gear for safety when riding ( ). Which of the following is NOT correct?

보기2: ② Electric two-wheeled parallel vehicle
보기3: ③ In-line skates
보기4: ④ Skateboard

문제: 165. Which of the following is correct about the duty to protect pedestrians?

보기2: ② It is okay to impede the passage of a pedestrian crossing a road that has traffic signals.

문제: 166. Which of the following persons or processions can pass through the center of a road?

문제: 167. Which of the following is the safest method to drive through a crosswalk with no traffic signals?

문제: 168. If a vehicle cannot be driven on the railroad crossing due to failure while passing through, which of the following is NOT the proper behavior by the driver?

문제: 169. A vehicle is about to go across a sidewalk to enter a building. Which of the following is the correct sequence?
보기1: ① Slow down → turn on the turn signal → enter quickly
보기2: ② Stop → honk the vehicle horn → enter quickly
보기3: ③ Slow down → check both sides → enter slowly

문제: 170. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is an INCORRECT description of safe pedestrian crossing?

보기2: ② Disabled pedestrians must cross the road using road-crossing facilities where such facilities are present.

문제: 173. Which of the following is the correct part of a footpath pedestrians should walk on?

문제: 174. A vehicle is about to drive across a crosswalk in a school zone with no traffic light. Which of the following are the correct actions of the driver? (Select two answers)

보기2: ② When there are pedestrians crossing, the driver must stop the vehicle and wait until all pedestrians have crossed.

문제: 175. According to the Road Traffic Act, which TWO of the following are correct explanations of pedestrian protection?

문제: 176. Which TWO of the following statements are good pedestrian behavior?

문제: 182. Which of the following is an INCORRECT method for a pedestrian to cross the road?

보기3: ③ A person who is pushing a stroller

문제: 189. Which of the following is the right method to drive when you spot a visually impaired person crossing the road with a guide dog?
보기1: ① Keep going if stopping or parking is not allowed in the area.
보기2: ② Stop momentarily.
보기3: ③ Stop and help the person go back the way he came.
보기4: ④ Protect the person by sounding the horn.

문제: 190. According to the Road Traffic Act, the driver of any type of vehicle must ( ) before reaching a crosswalk in a school zone with no traffic light, regardless of pedestrians crossing. Which of the following best fills the parentheses?
보기1: ① slow down
보기2: ② stop
보기3: ③ slow down or stop
보기4: ④ reduce speed

문제: 191. Which of the following statements is correct about a pedestrian crossing the road illegally?
보기1: ① You have no responsibility to protect pedestrians on sections of a road other than an intersection.
보기2: ② You have no responsibility to protect pedestrians crossing the road illegally.
보기3: ③ You have to protect pedestrians, even when they're crossing the road illegally.
보기4: ④ You have no responsibility to protect pedestrians crossing a one-way road illegally.

문제: 192. Which of the following pedestrians is NOT permitted in a roadway?
보기1: ① A person using a wheelchair to aid their movement
보기2: ② A person marching on the streets for an important social event
보기3: ③ A person cleaning or doing maintenance work on a road
보기4: ④ A person carrying an object that can hinder pedestrian thoroughfare, such as a ladder

문제: 193. Which of the following is the best method for a pedestrian to cross the road when the green light at the crosswalk is flashing?
보기1: ① A pedestrian who is not yet in the crosswalk must wait for the next green light to start crossing.
보기2: ② Stand still in the middle of the crosswalk.
보기3: ③ Cross the road without waiting for the next signal.
보기4: ④ You can start crossing the road whenever, as long as the light doesn't turn red.

문제: 194. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is correct regarding the pedestrians passing the sidewalk?
보기1: ① A person who passes the sidewalk or rides a two-wheeled vehicle up to 125cc can be considered a pedestrian.
보기2: ② A person riding a bicycle can be considered a pedestrian.
보기3: ③ A person who uses a wheelchair can be considered a pedestrian.
보기4: ④ A person who rides a 49cc motorcycle can be considered a pedestrian.

문제: 195. According to the Road Traffic Act, which TWO of the following correctly describe rules for the exclusive pedestrian road?
보기1: ① The driver of a motor or animal-drawn vehicle allowed on an exclusive pedestrian road must travel at the same speed as the pedestrians.
보기2: ② In principle, the driver of a motor or animal-drawn vehicle may use an exclusive pedestrian road.
보기3: ③ The driver of a motor or animal-drawn vehicle may not be allowed to enter an exclusive pedestrian road if and when the chief of police deems it necessary.
보기4: ④ If there is a possibility that pedestrians could be exposed to danger, the driver of a motor or animal-drawn vehicle on an exclusive pedestrian road must stop and remain stationary.

문제: 196. A vehicle dropped cargo in a protection area for older persons, resulting in an accident due to which an elderly person had to receive medical treatment for two weeks. According to the Act on Special Cases Concerning the Settlement of Traffic Accidents, which TWO of the following are correct regarding the penalties?
보기1: ① Criminal offense charges are imposed on the driver regardless of the victim’s wishes to file charges.
보기2: ② No charges are filed if the driver comes to an agreement with the victim.
보기3: ③ No charges are filed if the driver has a full-cover insurance policy.
보기4: ④ The driver is charged with criminal offense regardless of the presence of a full-cover insurance policy.

문제: 197. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is the most appropriate method for a pedestrian to cross a road without a crosswalk?
보기1: ① Cross the road right behind a passing vehicle
보기2: ② Cross the road quickly when there are no cars passing by
보기3: ③ Cross anywhere because there is no crosswalk
보기4: ④ Cross the road using the shortest distance

문제: 198. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is not a correct explanation of how to traverse a crosswalk?
보기1: ① A person may cross the crosswalk while pushing a personal mobility device.
보기2: ② A person may cross the crosswalk while on a motorized chair.
보기3: ③ A person may cross the crosswalk while riding a bicycle.
보기4: ④ A person may cross the crosswalk while pushing a stroller.

문제: 199. According to the Road Traffic Act, among the following methods of passage used by motor vehicles or horses, which one is not correct?
보기1: ① When the roadway and sidewalk are separated, be sure to use the roadway.
보기2: ② Drive slowly just before crossing a crosswalk, check to the left and right, and cross in a manner that does not impede the passage of pedestrians.
보기3: ③ From the center of the road, pass through the right side.
보기4: ④ If the road is for one-way traffic, pass through the center or left side of the road.

문제: 200. According to the Road Traffic Act, among the following guidelines for the protection of pedestrians, which one is not correct?
보기1: ① When a pedestrian is using the crosswalk, the driver must make a temporary stop before it.
보기2: ② The driver shall not impede the passage of pedestrians who are crossing the road according to the signal or direction given by a police officer.
보기3: ③ A driver shall not impede the passage of pedestrians who are crossing the road at an intersection.
보기4: ④ When a pedestrian is crossing a road without a crosswalk, the driver must drive slowly while maintaining a safe distance.

문제: 201. Which of the following is the correct method for a vehicle to pass through a crosswalk if traffic signals both for vehicles and pedestrians are out of order?
보기1: ① If a pedestrian is crossing, pass through at a slow speed.
보기2: ② If there are no pedestrians on the crosswalk, do not slow down and pass through quickly.
보기3: ③ The driver does not need to drive slowly, as the crosswalk has lost its function due to the breakdown of the signal lights.
보기4: ④ If a pedestrian is crossing, make a temporary stop just in front of the crosswalk.

문제: 202. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is the most appropriate method for a pedestrian in using a road that has no clear distinction of a sidewalk yet has a center line?
보기1: ① Walk along the center of the roadway.
보기2: ② Walk along the right side of the roadway.
보기3: ③ Walk along the roadside area.
보기4: ④ Use all areas of the road to walk on.

문제: 203. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is the correct method to pass for a motor vehicle or a horse that is permitted to pass through an exclusive road for pedestrians?
보기1: ① If there are any pedestrians, proceed slowly.
보기2: ② Proceed while sounding the horn.
보기3: ③ Drive at the walking speed of pedestrians or make a temporary stop.
보기4: ④ If there are no pedestrians, proceed quickly.

문제: 204. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is a section of road where boundaries are indicated by a line or curbstones, safety signs, or any similar artificial structures that allows pedestrians to pass through?
보기1: ① A sidewalk
보기2: ② A roadside area
보기3: ③ A crosswalk
보기4: ④ A bicycle crossing

문제: 205. According to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, which of the following is not the correct method to cross when pedestrian signals are flashing?
보기1: ① Pedestrians should not start crossing.
보기2: ② Pedestrians in the middle of the crossing should quickly finish crossing.
보기3: ③ Pedestrians should stop crossing and return to the sidewalk.
보기4: ④ Pedestrians should stop crossing and wait in place for the next signal.

문제: 206. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is a situation in which the driver of a motor vehicle must drive slowly?
보기1: ① When seeing a person crossing a crosswalk with a bicycle
보기2: ② When driving past a pedestrian along a back road
보기3: ③ When seeing a pedestrian crossing a crosswalk
보기4: ④ When seeing a pedestrian crossing a road where there is no crosswalk

문제: 207. According to the Road Traffic Act, raised crosswalks are installed on roads where it is necessary to limit the speed to ( ) km/h or less. Which of the following is correct?
208. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is NOT the circumstance that require a temporary stop while driving?
보기1: ① When a child crosses the road without a guardian
보기2: ② When the vehicle traffic light is flashing a red light
보기3: ③ When a child is sitting or standing on the road
보기4: ④ When the vehicle traffic light is flashing yellow.

문제: 209. According to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, which of the following is the correct method for motor vehicles or horses to pass through a diagonal crosswalk when its walk signal has changed to green?
보기1: ① They should stop.
보기2: ② They may make a right turn as long as they do not impede the crossing of pedestrians.
보기3: ③ If there are no pedestrians, they may proceed at a slow speed.
보기4: ④ They may proceed in the direction in which pedestrians are not crossing.

문제: 210. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is the correct term for a driver’s action to bring his/her motor vehicle to a complete stop temporarily?
보기1: ① Driving slowly
보기2: ② Stopping
보기3: ③ Parking
보기4: ④ Making a temporary stop

문제: 211. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is not permitted to be used by an electric wheelchair for medical purposes?
보기1: ① Exclusive roads for bicycles
보기2: ② A roadside area
보기3: ③ A sidewalk
보기4: ④ The edge of a road

문제: 212. Which of the following is the most appropriate way to make a left turn at an intersection without any traffic control?
보기1: ① On general roadways, turn on the direction indicator immediately before the intersection and turn left.
보기2: ② Slow down and follow the center line of the road, and turn left by going around the central island in the outer lane of the intersection.
보기3: ③ Turning left on the outer lane of the intersection is not allowed even when permitted by the commissioner of City/Do police agency.
보기4: ④ You must slow down. You may or may not stop at your discretion as you enter.

문제: 213. According to the Road Traffic Act, the width of a lane installed shall be ( ) meters or wider. In such cases where an unavoidable need is recognized, such as for the installation of a left turn-only lane, it may be set to ( ) centimeters or wider. Which combination of answers fits in the two parentheses?
214. In which of the following cases is a vehicle allowed to overtake another vehicle on a road with its right side narrower than six meters?
보기1: ① When the left side of the road cannot be checked
보기2: ② When the traffic in the opposite direction may be impeded
보기3: ③ When the car ahead proceeds at a low speed and a safe distance can be secured from other cars
보기4: ④ When overtaking is prohibited or restricted and the prohibition/restriction is indicated by safety signs, etc.

문제: 215. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following lanes indicate the direction of traffic with a signal apparatus on the road in which the traffic volume of both directions varies greatly depending on the time, in order to optimize the number of lanes available for the direction with the greatest traffic volume?
보기1: ① Reversible lane
보기2: ② Exclusive lane for buses
보기3: ③ Acceleration lane
보기4: ④ Overtaking lane

문제: 216. According to the Road Traffic Act, the driver of any type of vehicle trying to make a ( ) must be in the right-most lane and slow down to make a ( ) at an intersection. In this case, the driver trying to make a ( ) must stop the vehicle according to the traffic signal or take caution for pedestrians and bicycle riders. Which of the following best fills the parentheses?
보기1: ① right turn – right turn – right turn
보기2: ② left turn – left turn – left turn
보기3: ③ right turn – left turn – right turn
보기4: ④ left turn – right turn – left turn

문제: 217. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is correct regarding a change of lane?
보기1: ① Because it can be dangerous on a bridge, a change of lane is often restricted by solid white lines.
보기2: ② Broken white lines mark traffic lanes where a change of lane is limited.
보기3: ③ Do not change lanes in an area where a lane change is prohibited, even if there is roadwork or other such obstructions that prevent you from traveling further.
보기4: ④ It is not against the law to change lanes in an area where a lane change is prohibited, provided that it is done safely.

문제: 218. Which of the following infringements apply when you queue across an intersection and block traffic from other directions even after the lights change?
보기1: ① Violation of means for passing through intersections
보기2: ② Violation of a temporary stop
보기3: ③ Violation of means for changing lanes
보기4: ④ Violation of measures for preventing congestion

문제: 219. Which of the following is a correct statement regarding an acceleration lane on an expressway?
보기1: ① An acceleration lane induces vehicles on an expressway to change lanes so that they can take an exit.
보기2: ② An acceleration lane induces the vehicles entering an expressway to increase their speed.
보기3: ③ An acceleration lane induces vehicles trying to overtake other vehicles on an expressway to increase their speed.
보기4: ④ An acceleration lane is designed to lessen the effects of the lowered speed of large vehicles when driving uphill.

문제: 220. Which of the following is the most appropriate action to take when a driver realizes that he/she incorrectly entered an expressway after he/she has already entered it?
보기1: ① Pull over, turn on the emergency flashers, and call the expressway patrol for help.
보기2: ② Take the next exit as he/she has already entered the expressway.
보기3: ③ Turn on the emergency flashers and slowly reverse the vehicle back to the entry point to exit the expressway.
보기4: ④ If there are two or more lanes, make a U-turn to exit the expressway.

문제: 221. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is an incorrect match between the type of lane and the color painted on the lane?
보기1: ① Yellow color for separating bidirectional traffic in a safety zone
보기2: ② Blue color for exclusive lanes used by buses
보기3: ③ Pink, light green or green colors for guide lines on the lane
보기4: ④ White color for the outer line of the speed limit mark installed within a school zone

문제: 222. According to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, which of the following is the correct type of vehicle that may be driven on the left-side lane on roads other than expressways?
보기1: ① Passenger cars and compact, small and mid-sized vans
보기2: ② Large passenger vehicles
보기3: ③ Trucks
보기4: ④ Special-purpose cars and two-wheeled vehicles

문제: 223. On which of the following sections is the driver of a car permitted to make a U-turn?
보기1: ① A section of road marked with a solid yellow line
보기2: ② A section of road marked with a solid white line
보기3: ③ A section of road marked with a broken white line
보기4: ④ A section of road marked with a solid blue line

문제: 224. The following are the classifications of traffic by the type of lane according to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree. Which of the following is incorrect?
보기1: ① With regard to the ordering of lanes, the lane next to the median lane of a road is regarded as the first lane.
보기2: ② If a person drives at a slow speed and may impede the normal traffic of other cars, he/she must change to the lane right of the one he/she was originally on.
보기3: ③ On a road with one-way traffic, the right side of the road is regarded as the first lane.
보기4: ④ In principle, all vehicles on a four-lane expressway must drive in the second lane.

문제: 225. Under the Road Traffic Act, if the visibility distance is less than 50 meters due to heavy rain, the speed of a vehicle must be reduced by ( ) of the maximum prescribed speed. Which fits the parentheses?
226. According to the Road Traffic Act, which two of the following correctly describe the criteria for vehicles that may drive on exclusive lanes for high-occupancy vehicles?
보기1: ① Passenger cars with 3 or more persons
보기2: ② Trucks with 3 or more persons
보기3: ③ Vans with 3 or more persons
보기4: ④ Two-wheeled vehicles with 2 or more persons

문제: 227. According to the Road Traffic Act, when installing a lane on a road in which the sidewalk and the road are not separately demarcated, which of the following is to be installed on both sides of the road for pedestrians to pass through safely?
보기1: ① Safety area
보기2: ② Lane change restriction line sign
보기3: ③ Roadside
보기4: ④ Roadside area

문제: 228. Which of the following is the correct method of passing through an intersection that has two left turn lanes?
보기1: ① Passenger cars must use only the first lane to turn left.
보기2: ② Passenger cars must use only the second lane to turn left.
보기3: ③ Large vans must use only the first lane to turn left.
보기4: ④ Large vans must use only the second lane to turn left.

문제: 229. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is incorrect regarding the method and speed to be followed by motor vehicles and horses?
보기1: ① If there is another vehicle coming straight from the opposite direction when you attempt to make a left turn at an intersection where there are no traffic lights, you shall yield the route to the vehicle coming straight.
보기2: ② If a vehicle makes a stop on a road with no distinction between the roadway and sidewalk, it should stop at a distance of at least 50 centimeters from the right edge of the road.
보기3: ③ If the vehicle in front signals its intent to make a right turn at an intersection, the trailing vehicle shall not impede the vehicle in front from proceeding.
보기4: ④ The minimum speed on exclusive roads for motor vehicles is 40 kilometers per hour.

문제: 230. Which of the following is the maximum allowed speed for a truck with a 3-ton loading weight driving on an eight-lane expressway (four lanes in each direction) on which the maximum allowable speed is 100 kilometers per hour?
보기1: ① 60 kilometers per hour
보기2: ② 70 kilometers per hour
보기3: ③ 80 kilometers per hour
보기4: ④ 90 kilometers per hour

문제: 231. In which of the following situations are motor vehicles and horses NOT allowed to pass along the left side of a road?
보기1: ① When restriction of overtaking is indicated by safety signs, etc.
보기2: ② When the road is designated for one-way traffic
보기3: ③ The right side of the road is not available for passage due to road construction, etc.
보기4: ④ When the right side of the road is not wide enough for the passage of motor vehicles and horses

문제: 232. Which of the following is the most inappropriate method of passing an intersection and Dilemma Zone?
보기1: ① Before entering the intersection, check the traffic conditions in advance, keep a safe distance and drive at a reduced speed anticipating all situations, and drive defensively.
보기2: ② Entering the intersection at a red light leads to a signal violation.
보기3: ③ If the front wheel enters the stop line when the traffic light changes from green to yellow, watch the traffic conditions and proceed quickly out of the intersection.
보기4: ④ The faster the speeding situation at the intersection, the shorter the dilemma zone, which leads to a quicker decision from the driver.

문제: 233. Which of the following explanations regarding the driving distance between vehicles is correct?
보기1: ① Free running distance is the distance a vehicle travels from the point when the brake is pressed after detecting danger until the point at which the brake starts to work.
보기2: ② Stopping distance is the distance necessary to avoid a rear-end collision with the car in front of you if it makes an abrupt stop.
보기3: ③ Safe distance is the distance a vehicle travels from the point the brake is applied to the point at which the vehicle comes to a complete stop.
보기4: ④ Braking distance is the distance between the moment the driver detects danger and the moment the car comes to a full stop.

문제: 234. Which of the following area is overtaking a vehicle possible?
보기1: ① Intersection
보기2: ② Center line (yellow broken line)
보기3: ③ Inside the tunnel (white broken line)
보기4: ④ On the bridge (white broken line)

문제: 235. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is the most appropriate method of slowing down at an intersection?
보기1: ① Proceeding at a low speed such that the vehicle can be stopped immediately
보기2: ② Proceeding while maintaining a speed of 30 kilometers per hour
보기3: ③ Proceeding at such a low speed that no accident is caused
보기4: ④ Proceeding at a speed that enables the driver to avoid any sudden stops by the vehicle in front

문제: 236. The following are various explanations of the punishment criteria for driving a vehicle (except for personal mobility devices) in violation of the maximum speed on the road. Which one is correct?
보기1: ① A person who drives three or more times at a speed exceeding 100 km/h is subject to a fine up to 5 million won or confinement.
보기2: ② Anyone who drives three or more times at a speed exceeding 100 km/h is subject to imprisonment up to one year or a fine up to 5 million won.
보기3: ③ A person who drives twice at a speed exceeding 100 km/h is subject to a fine up to 3 million won.
보기4: ④ Anyone who drives at a speed exceeding 80 km/h is subject to a fine up to 500,000 won or detention.

문제: 237. Which of the following is the correct method to turn right at an intersection with no traffic lights?
보기1: ① Turn right as fast as possible.
보기2: ② Wait until the vehicles entering the intersection ahead of you pass by, and then make a right turn.
보기3: ③ When a vehicle coming in the opposite direction is making a left turn, turn right at the same time with caution.
보기4: ④ There is no need to be mindful of other vehicles when you turn right from a wide road onto a narrow one.

문제: 238. A driver intends to make a right turn at an intersection where traffic signals are present but auxiliary signals for vehicles are not installed. Which of the following is not correct according to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree?
보기1: ① If the traffic signal has turned red, a temporary stop must be made in front of the stop line regardless of the signal light for pedestrians at the crosswalk.
보기2: ② If the traffic signal has turned green, a right turn may be made without making a temporary stop in front of the stop line.
보기3: ③ If the traffic signal displays a green arrow, a temporary stop must be made in front of the stop line regardless of the signal light for pedestrians at the crosswalk.
보기4: ④ Regardless of the traffic signal, a right turn may be made without making a temporary stop when it does not impede other vehicles.

문제: 239. At an intersection, which of the following is the most correct method to make a left/right turn?
보기1: ① When making a right turn, quickly pass through the intersection while carefully checking for pedestrians and bicycles that stop or proceed according to the signal.
보기2: ② When making a left turn, you must pass through the outside of the intersection center.
보기3: ③ When making a right turn, reduce speed in advance while driving along the right edge of the road.
보기4: ④ When making a left turn at an intersection without traffic signals while a pedestrian is crossing the road, quickly pass in front of the pedestrian.

문제: 240. Which of the following correctly describes the stopping distance?
보기1: ① The distance from the point at which a driver pushes the brake pedal to where the vehicle comes to a complete stop
보기2: ② The distance that allows a driver to avoid colliding with a vehicle ahead when it makes a sudden stop
보기3: ③ The distance that a vehicle travels from the point at which the driver detects danger and steps on the brake pedal to the point at which the vehicle makes a complete stop
보기4: ④ The distance from the point where a driver senses danger and presses the brake pedal to the point where the brake function actually starts to work

문제: 241. Which of the following is the correct method of passing through an intersection?
보기1: ① When the red traffic light is flashing, drive slowly.
보기2: ② When the yellow traffic light is flashing, drive through as quickly as you can.
보기3: ③ Do not overtake other vehicles at an intersection.
보기4: ④ When you approach the intersection, always use high-beam headlights.

문제: 242. The following describes a Hi-pass lane. Which is correct?
보기1: ① A Hi-pass lane is always found in lane 1; drivers intending to take it must change lanes accordingly and pass through the toll road safely.
보기2: ② Since the Hi-pass lane for trucks is exclusive to trucks and is colored blue, there is no need to slow down to pass through the toll road.
보기3: ③ Drivers must reduce speed in advance since the speed limit of a multi-lane Hi-pass toll road is 30 kph.
보기4: ④ Drivers must observe the speed limit of a multi-lane Hi-pass toll road. If the Hi-pass device malfunctions upon entry, the drivers can pay the toll upon exit.

문제: 243. On a section of a six-lane (three lanes in each direction) motor vehicle-only lane, you see a safety sign stating that the speed limit is 60 kilometers per hour. Which of the following is compliant with traffic rules?
보기1: ① Driving at 90 kilometers per hour
보기2: ② Driving at 80 kilometers per hour
보기3: ③ Driving at 70 kilometers per hour
보기4: ④ Driving at 60 kilometers per hour

문제: 244. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following speed limits can be placed on a general road in residential, commercial and industrial areas?
보기1: ① Within 20 km/h
보기2: ② Within 30 km/h
보기3: ③ Within 40 km/h
보기4: ④ Within 50 km/h
