문제: 245. Which of the following is the policy that limits the maximum speed in the city center to 50 km/h, while in the back road (including residential areas) this is lowered to 30 km/h in order to reduce traffic accidents?
보기1: ① New Deal Policy
보기2: ② Safety Speed 5030
보기3: ③ Campaign for Unity in Order to Reduce Traffic Accidents
보기4: ④ Intelligent Transportation System (ITS)

문제: 246. Which TWO of the following are correct methods for making a left turn at an intersection with unprotected left turns?
보기1: ① Turn left on the green light if there is no vehicle coming from the opposite direction.
보기2: ② Turn left on the red light when all the vehicles coming from the opposite direction come to a stop before the stop line.
보기3: ③ If an accident occurs while you are making an unprotected left turn on the green light, you will be held guilty of violating driving safety rules.
보기4: ④ If an accident occurs while you are making an unprotected left turn on the red light, you will be held guilty of violating driving safety rules.

문제: 247. You are driving in a city that operates an exclusive median bus lane system. Which of the following are safe ways to drive? (Select two answers)
보기1: ① You should continuously use the vehicle horn to prevent other vehicles from cutting in front of you.
보기2: ② You should drive with caution as pedestrians on the right may try to jaywalk.
보기3: ③ You should slow down as pedestrians may cross the road from the bus station on the left.
보기4: ④ You should drive and pass through a median bus lane as quickly as possible before the traffic light turns red.

문제: 248. According to the Road Traffic Act, which TWO of the following are safe methods to change lanes?
보기1: ① Change lanes as quickly as possible.
보기2: ② You can change lanes only in those sections marked with solid white lines.
보기3: ③ Change lanes without obstructing traffic.
보기4: ④ You can change lanes only on a road marked with a white broken line.

문제: 249. Which TWO of the following are correct methods to safely make a right turn at an intersection?
보기1: ① Use the turn indicator at least 30 m before where you want to make a right turn.
보기2: ② Move into the right-hand lane carefully if there is a solid white line on the road.
보기3: ③ Make a right turn after checking your left side to make sure there are no other vehicles headed in the same direction as you.
보기4: ④ Make a right turn quickly while paying attention to the traffic in the area.

문제: 250. Which TWO of the following are correct methods for a passenger car driver to overtake another vehicle?
보기1: ① Make sure there is enough space on the left before overtaking.
보기2: ② While on an expressway, overtaking should be done within the speed limit
보기3: ③ If it is safe to do so, overtaking another vehicle on its right hand side is acceptable.
보기4: ④ After passing a vehicle on its left, move back into the lane when the vehicle just passed is not visible in the rear-view mirror.

문제: 251. Which TWO of the following are the safest approaches to driving on the road?
보기1: ① Park the vehicle in a safety zone if possible.
보기2: ② When the traffic lights turn yellow, stop inside the intersection to observe the traffic signal.
보기3: ③ Keep sufficient distance to prevent a collision with the vehicle ahead if it brakes suddenly.
보기4: ④ When overtaking other vehicles, pass along the left side of the vehicle.

문제: 252. When an emergency vehicle is coming up behind you as you enter an expressway, which of the following is the most appropriate response?
보기1: ① Enter the roadside of the acceleration lane and drive at an increased speed.
보기2: ② Accelerate and change lanes immediately after entering the expressway so that the emergency vehicle can pass by.
보기3: ③ Stop temporarily on the roadside and enter the expressway after the emergency vehicle.
보기4: ④ Proceed at the same speed because stopping or driving slowly on an expressway is dangerous.

문제: 253. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following measures must be taken when an emergency vehicle driving with an emergency siren on approaches?
보기1: ① When an emergency vehicle approaches an intersection, drivers of other vehicles must stop at the left edge of the intersection.
보기2: ② On the road other than the intersection, other vehicles should yield so that emergency vehicles can pass first.
보기3: ③ Drive faster than the emergency vehicle.
보기4: ④ Stop temporarily and wait until the emergency vehicle passes.

문제: 254. Which of the following is the safest measure to take when a fire truck approaches with flashing red lights and a siren while you are trying to make a right turn at an intersection?
보기1: ① Temporarily stop, avoiding the intersection.
보기2: ② Stop right where you are.
보기3: ③ Slow down, and turn right.
보기4: ④ Pass through the intersection quickly and continue driving.

문제: 255. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following privileges does NOT apply to emergency vehicles?
보기1: ① Speed limit of motor vehicles
보기2: ② Restriction of overtaking
보기3: ③ Restriction of cutting in
보기4: ④ Ensure pedestrian safety

문제: 256. Emergency vehicles should be properly outfitted and should inform that they are undertaking an emergency operation by turning on their sirens or flashing lights. Which of the following vehicles is exempt from this obligation?
보기1: ① Vehicles cracking down on illegal parking
보기2: ② Fire trucks
보기3: ③ Ambulances
보기4: ④ Police cars cracking down on violations of speed limit

문제: 257. In order for fire trucks and ambulances to be granted a special privilege to overtake other vehicles or drive at a speed exceeding the limit in a no-passing zone, which of the following is the measure that the drivers of those vehicles should take?
보기1: ① Drive while honking horns.
보기2: ② Equip the cars in a manner required for safe driving according to the Motor Vehicle Management Act and turn on the sirens or flashing lights.
보기3: ③ Drive with the headlights on.
보기4: ④ Those vehicles can be granted such privileges without taking additional measures.

문제: 258. Which of the following is necessary for a general car to be recognized as an emergency vehicle when it is transporting a patient in critical condition?
보기1: ① The car should be authorized by the chief of the district police station.
보기2: ② The driver should turn on the headlights or emergency lights.
보기3: ③ The car does not need to get special permission because it is transporting a patient in critical condition.
보기4: ④ The car must be escorted by another vehicle.

문제: 259. According to the Road Traffic Act, which TWO of the following are considered emergency vehicles?
보기1: ① A fire truck going to a repair shop for repairs
보기2: ② A vehicle transporting patients that are injured or in a critical condition, or transporting blood for transfusion
보기3: ③ An ambulance transporting a patient discharged from a medical institution
보기4: ④ A vehicle authorized by the commissioner of City/Do police agency. to transport urgent postal mail, etc.

문제: 260. According to the Road Traffic Act, which TWO of the following is an ambulance driver allowed to do while operating an emergency vehicle in an emergency situation?
보기1: ① Continue to operate the vehicle after a traffic accident without administering first aid to the injured.
보기2: ② Continue to operate the vehicle even if it obstructs pedestrians from crossing.
보기3: ③ Drive along the center or along the left side of the road.
보기4: ④ Cut in front of other vehicles on a congested road.

문제: 261. Which of the following actions cannot be taken by the driver of a fire truck while it is being run for an intended purpose?
보기1: ① Not wearing a seat belt
보기2: ② Drunk driving
보기3: ③ Crossing of the centerline
보기4: ④ Violation of traffic light

문제: 262. The regular traffic safety education provided for drivers of emergency vehicles shall be taken every ( ) years. Which of the following best fits in ( )?
보기1: ① 1
보기2: ② 2
보기3: ③ 3
보기4: ④ 5

문제: 263. Among the following explanations regarding special cases involving emergency vehicles, which one is NOT correct?
보기1: ① They may overtake other vehicles at a location where passing is prohibited.
보기2: ② They may cut in front of other vehicles even where cutting is prohibited.
보기3: ③ They may pass the crossroad even though there is a pedestrian crossing it without regard for their safety.
보기4: ④ They may drive faster than the speed limit prescribed for the road.

문제: 264. Which of the following is a blood bank vehicle urgently responding to a request for blood NOT permitted to do?
보기1: ① Turning on the siren
보기2: ② Driving on the left side of the road
보기3: ③ Driving at a speed over the legal limit
보기4: ④ Continuing to drive without taking necessary actions if an accident occurs

문제: 265. Which of the following can be designated as an emergency vehicle by the commissioner of City/Do police agency at the request of the organization or the person that intends to use the vehicle?
보기1: ① A fire truck
보기2: ② A gasworks vehicle used for emergency gas leakage repair
보기3: ③ An ambulance
보기4: ④ A blood bank vehicle

문제: 266. Which of the following can NOT be designated as an emergency vehicle by the commissioner of City/Do police agency at the request of the organization or the person that intends to use the vehicle?
보기1: ① A police car used for traffic control
보기2: ② A vehicle used for delivery of urgent mail
보기3: ③ A vehicle used for emergency work such as repair of phone lines
보기4: ④ A civil defense vehicle used for emergency restorations

문제: 267. According to the Road Traffic Act, which one of the following is NOT a situation in which an emergency vehicle can flash its warning lights for non-emergency matters?
보기1: ① When a fire truck is on patrol for fire prevention, rescue, and emergency activities
보기2: ② When a fire truck is being driven to the workshop for urgent repair
보기3: ③ When a vehicle commissioned for civil defense activities participates in a drill relevant to its usual emergency responsibilities
보기4: ④ When a police vehicle is on patrol for crime prevention and control

문제: 268. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following actions by an emergency vehicle on an emergency rescue mission is considered an offense?
보기1: ① Driving at 100 kilometers per hour on a four-lane (two lanes in each direction) general road
보기2: ② Overtaking a vehicle inside a tunnel where lanes are marked with a solid white line
보기3: ③ Cutting in front of a vehicle at an intersection to turn right
보기4: ④ Failing to report or take necessary actions in the event of a traffic accident resulting in personal injury because the vehicle is on an emergency rescue mission

문제: 269. Which of the following is NOT an instance where an emergency vehicle can use a light bar for a non-emergency purpose?
보기1: ① A fire truck on a round of patrol for fire prevention
보기2: ② A road maintenance vehicle on a round of patrol to prevent traffic accidents
보기3: ③ An ambulance used in emergency response training
보기4: ④ A police car on a round of patrol for crime prevention

문제: 270. Which TWO of the following are correct methods to yield to an emergency vehicle on the road?
보기1: ① All vehicles must pull over to the left side of the road.
보기2: ② If the emergency vehicle is climbing up a narrow slope and you are facing it, the emergency vehicle must pull over to the right to make way for you.
보기3: ③ Near an intersection, pull over at some distance from the intersection.
보기4: ④ When an emergency vehicle approaches from a place other than an intersection or its vicinity, the roadway shall be yielded so that the emergency vehicle can take priority.

문제: 271. Which TWO of the following are considered emergency vehicles?
보기1: ① A vehicle being guided by a police car for emergency purposes
보기2: ② An investigation vehicle used for non-investigatory purposes
보기3: ③ A recovery vehicle used to tow a vehicle involved in an accident
보기4: ④ A vehicle transporting patients that are injured or in critical condition, or transporting blood for transfusion

문제: 272. Which of the following is not true about the duty of a school bus driver and operator?
보기1: ① A school bus driver must turn on the hazard lights only when children and infants are getting on or off the bus.
보기2: ② A school bus driver must make sure all children and infants on board are wearing seat belts before moving the bus.
보기3: ③ In case parents or guardians are on board together with the children, a school bus operator may post a sign indicating the accompaniment of parents/guardians.
보기4: ④ In case parents or guardians are on board, there is no need to write safety operation records.

문제: 273. In which location should the driver come to a full stop, regardless of the existence of pedestrians?
보기1: ① A road with no center line among the roads where the roadway and sidewalk are not distinguishable
보기2: ② Front of a crosswalk in a school zone with no traffic light
보기3: ③ Pedestrians-first road
보기4: ④ A place other than a road

문제: 274. A school bus for children is driving in the first lane of a four-lane (two lanes in each direction) road with markings to show that it has children or infants on board. Which of the following is the safest course of action?
보기1: ① Do not overtake the bus even if the second lane is empty.
보기2: ② Overtake the bus using the second lane.
보기3: ③ Honk the horn to send a signal to make way.
보기4: ④ Check the situation of the traffic coming in the opposite direction, and overtake the bus by crossing the center line.

문제: 275. Which of the following is correct about school zones?
보기1: ① Areas in front of kindergartens or middle schools are designated as school zones.
보기2: ② Mayors and other officials can limit or prohibit vehicles from entering a school zone.
보기3: ③ For the purposes of a school zone, children are defined as those under 12 years old.
보기4: ④ A school zone can limit vehicles to a speed within 30km/h.

문제: 276. Which of the following is correct regarding punishments according to the Act on Special Cases Concerning the Settlement of Traffic Accidents for violating the speed limit in a school zone and injuring a child?
보기1: ① Only if demanded by the victim will the offender be subjected to criminal punishment.
보기2: ② Regardless of the victim's request, criminal punishment will be administered.
보기3: ③ When insured by comprehensive insurance, the driver will not face criminal punishment.
보기4: ④ An agreement with the victim can prevent criminal punishment.

문제: 277. Which of the following is the allowed seating capacity for a vehicle to be registered as a school bus for children? (1 child is considered as 1 passenger)
보기1: ① 11-seater or larger
보기2: ② 16-seater or larger
보기3: ③ 17-seater or larger
보기4: ④ 9-seater or larger

문제: 278. How many demerit points is the driver of a passenger car given if he/she breaks the speed limit in a school zone by 25 km/h at approximately 08
보기1: ① 10 points
보기2: ② 15 points
보기3: ③ 30 points
보기4: ④ 60 points

문제: 279. How many demerit points are imposed on the driver of a passenger car who overtakes a school bus for children that is driving on a road with an indication that it has children or infants on board?
보기1: ① 10 points
보기2: ② 15 points
보기3: ③ 30 points
보기4: ④ 40 points

문제: 280. According to the Road Traffic Act, how many hours of safety education are required for persons subject to the education regarding school buses for children?
보기1: ① 1 hour or more
보기2: ② 3 hours or more
보기3: ③ 5 hours or more
보기4: ④ 6 hours or more

문제: 281. According to the Road Traffic Act, who are considered children and infants?
보기1: ① Those who are 13 years old or below are considered children
보기2: ② Those who are below 6 years old are considered infants
보기3: ③ Those who are below 15 years old are considered children
보기4: ④ Those who are below 7 years old are considered infants

문제: 282. Which of the following is the correct amount of fine that would be imposed on the driver of a passenger car who commits a traffic signal violation in a school zone at around 13
보기1: ① KRW 50,000
보기2: ② KRW 70,000

문제: 283. Which of the following is the safest method to drive on a road where a child is playing alone without a guardian?
보기1: ① The child shouldn't be there in the first place. Just drive on.
보기2: ② Use the horn to scare the child away and drive past.
보기3: ③ Stop temporarily.
보기4: ④ Keep an eye on the child and speed away.

문제: 284. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is a correct action taken by a driver when a child is crossing in a crosswalk?
보기1: ① A pedestrian crossing sign recommends pedestrians use the crosswalk; therefore, the driver must make a full stop before reaching the crosswalk.
보기2: ② In the case of a crosswalk on a general road with no traffic light, the driver can pass the stop line as long as he/she doesn’t enter the crosswalk area.
보기3: ③ In the case of a crosswalk on a general road with no traffic light, the driver can drive slowly behind crossing children.
보기4: ④ Pedestrian crossing signs are placed on both ends of a crosswalk, and all drivers must come to a full stop before reaching the crosswalk.

문제: 285. If a school bus for children makes a stop at a two-lane (one lane in each direction) road and switches on the flashers to indicate that infants are getting on and off the bus, which of the following is the correct behavior for a driver approaching from the opposite direction?
보기1: ① Stop temporarily, check that it is safe, and drive on slowly.
보기2: ② Drive past at a reduced speed to ensure safety.
보기3: ③ Continue to drive on.
보기4: ④ Drive on while using the horn.

문제: 286. Which of the following is the most appropriate behavior when a driver hits a child?
보기1: ① A driver of a two-wheeled vehicle asked if a child is injured or not, but the child did not say anything. So the driver decided that the child was not injured and kept driving.
보기2: ② The driver of a passenger car stopped the vehicle immediately, visually checked the child, and concluded that the child was not injured and so kept driving.
보기3: ③ The driver of a truck saw a child who fell but got up immediately. Upon concluding that the child was not injured, the driver kept driving.
보기4: ④ A cyclist saw that a child fell off but quickly got up and ran. The cyclist reported the case to the police station and waited at the scene.

문제: 287. A vehicle just hit a child who suddenly came out from an alleyway. The child appeared unharmed and claimed that he was fine. Which of the following is the correct action taken by the driver?
보기1: ① The driver can leave since this is one of the offenses unpunishable over objection.
보기2: ② The driver can leave since the child was not hurt and thus this is not considered an accident.
보기3: ③ The driver must call the parents of the child and take other necessary measures before leaving the scene.
보기4: ④ Since the fault is on the child, the driver can just take the child's contact information and leave..

문제: 288. Who is responsible for designation and management of school zones under the Road Traffic Act?
보기1: ① Police chief
보기2: ② Mayor, etc.
보기3: ③ The commissioner of City/Do police agency
보기4: ④ The superintendent of Education

문제: 289. Which TWO of the following statements are correct about school zones?
보기1: ① A school zone refers to a section of a road located within 100m from the main gate of an elementary school.
보기2: ② A fine can be imposed for cars that are stopped or parked illegally in a school zone between 8 a.m. and 8 p.m.
보기3: ③ The length of the green signal of traffic lights installed in a school zone is based on the fastest walking speed of an average child.
보기4: ④ The demerit points applied to drivers who fail to consider pedestrian safety are doubled in school zones between 8 a.m. and 8 p.m.

문제: 290. Which TWO of the following are correct about the special protection of a school bus for children?
보기1: ① The method to overtake a school bus for children is the same as the method prescribed to overtake other kinds of cars.
보기2: ② When children are getting on or off the bus, a car coming from the opposite direction on a road without a center line should check that it is safe and drive slowly.
보기3: ③ When children are getting on or off the bus, a car coming from the opposite direction on a two-lane (one lane in each direction) road should stop momentarily, check that it is safe, and drive slowly.
보기4: ④ When children are getting on or off the bus, cars in the same lane and adjacent lanes should stop momentarily, check that it is safe, and drive slowly.

문제: 291. The following are descriptions of a thoroughfare of bicycles. Which of the following is incorrect according to the Road Traffic Act?
보기1: ① The rider of a bicycle must pass along a bicycle track at a location where a separate bicycle track exists.
보기2: ② The rider of a bicycle must pass along close to the right side of the road at a location where no bicycle track is constructed.
보기3: ③ The rider of a bicycle may pass along the roadside area (excluding a section where thoroughfare for bicycles is prohibited with safety markings).
보기4: ④ When the rider of a bicycle intends to cross the road at a crosswalk, he/she may do so while riding the bicycle.

문제: 292. Which ministries are responsible for jointly establishing the procedure and criteria for designating priority zones under the Road Traffic Act?
보기1: ① A school zone is jointly designated by the Ministry of Interior and Safety, the Ministry of Health and Welfare, and the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure and Transport.
보기2: ② A silver zone is jointly designated by the Ministry of Interior and Safety, the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure and Transport, and the Ministry of Environment.
보기3: ③ A priority zone for persons with disabilities is jointly designated by the Ministry of Interior and Safety, the Ministry of Health and Welfare, and the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure and Transport.
보기4: ④ A priority zone for people with mobility impairments is jointly designated by the Ministry of Interior and Safety, the Ministry of Environment, and the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure and Transport.

문제: 293. Which of the following is the correct method to drive considering the protection of school buses for children?
보기1: ① If you are facing and approaching a school bus for children on a two-lane (one lane in each direction) road, you must stop before reaching the bus, check that it is safe, and drive on slowly.
보기2: ② If a school bus for children has switched on flashers indicating that children are getting off, you must take another lane and drive past the bus quickly.
보기3: ③ If there is no centerline and you are facing and approaching a school bus for children, you must keep driving on at the same speed.
보기4: ④ You can overtake a school bus for children, even if it has signs indicating that children are on board.

문제: 294. Which TWO of the following are correct statements regarding registration of school buses for children?
보기1: ① You must register with the Road Traffic Authority, and a certificate of registration should be obtained before operating a school bus for children.
보기2: ② A school bus for children must be a vehicle with a maximum passenger capacity of nine or more (1 child is considered as 1 passenger).
보기3: ③ If applying to renew the registration of a school bus for children because the old one needs to be replaced, the old registration must be submitted with the renewal form.
보기4: ④ The registration certificate of a school bus for children must be attached in a place at the top left side of the windshield where it will be easily visible.

문제: 295. Which of the following is the correct method for a driver operating a school bus for children to get a child on and off board?
보기1: ① Flashers must be used to ensure safety while the child is on board.
보기2: ② If traffic is congested, turn off the flashers momentarily and get the child on board.
보기3: ③ Drop off children around the school bus and leave immediately.
보기4: ④ Fastening a seatbelt is not required in a school zone.

문제: 296. Which of the following is an incorrect statement about school zones?
보기1: ① The fine associated with a school zone is the same as that associated with a protection area for older persons.
보기2: ② A 'slow' sign can be installed in school zones.
보기3: ③ Stopping and parking can be prohibited in school zones.
보기4: ④ One will face a criminal penalty by causing an accident in which a child is injured, regardless of any settlements.

문제: 297. A child crosses a street in a school zone with another child. Which of the following is the correct driving behavior?
보기1: ① Stop temporarily to protect children and infants.
보기2: ② Slow down as a child crosses the street while protecting infants.
보기3: ③ Drive fast as the child and infant are on the opposite side of the road.
보기4: ④ As children and infants walk slowly, keep a safe distance and drive while avoiding them.

문제: 298. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is correct regarding school zones?
보기1: ① If a car accident occurs while a child is jaywalking, the driver is exempted from all liabilities.
보기2: ② If a cyclist hits a child while driving, only civil liability exists as a bicycle is not a vehicle.
보기3: ③ Upon seeing a child jumping into the road suddenly, stop the vehicle instead of reducing the speed.
보기4: ④ The chief of a police station may set the speed limit of a vehicle at 50km or less per hour.

문제: 299. Which of the following is true about school zones and driving in these zones? (Select two answers)
보기1: ① A school zone may limit the vehicle speed to 30 kph if necessary to ensure children's safety. Drivers must drive within the speed limit when driving in a school zone.
보기2: ② With regard to ① above, drivers of motor vehicles, motorcycles, and trams must observe the speed limit and come to a full stop when children are crossing.
보기3: ③ Roads near alternative or international schools are not designated as school zones; therefore, drivers must slow down when driving in these areas as children may be jaywalking.
보기4: ④ Speed limit and pedestrian crossing signs can be placed with priority in school zones. Drivers must slow down when a child is standing by the center line.

문제: 300. What is the fine the driver of a passenger car is liable to pay if he/she violates the obligation to protect a school bus for children?
보기2: ② KRW 90,000
보기3: ③ KRW 70,000
보기4: ④ KRW 50,000

문제: 301. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is true about a child and an infant and the responsibilities of a school bus driver?
보기1: ① Those who are 13 years old or below are considered children, and a school bus driver must ensure safety when children are getting on and off the bus.
보기2: ② A school bus driver must make sure that all children, except infants, have put on their seat belts before departure.
보기3: ③ A school bus driver must safely drop off a child at the destination demanded by the child.
보기4: ④ Those who are below 6 years old are considered infants, and a school bus driver must turn on the hazard lights when an infant is getting on and off the bus.

문제: 302. Which of the following is the correct method to operate the yellow and red indicator lights installed on a school bus for children for the safety of the children?
보기1: ① The red indicator light(s) must be flashing when stopping the bus.
보기2: ② The red indicator light(s) must be flashing when braking.
보기3: ③ The yellow indicator light(s) must be flashing when attempting to stop on the road.
보기4: ④ Both the yellow and red indicator light(s) must be flashing when parking.

문제: 303. Which of the following is NOT a law that is the basis for designating a school zone?
보기1: ① Early Childhood Education Act
보기2: ② Elementary and Secondary Education Act
보기3: ③ Act on the Establishment and Operation of Private Teaching Institutes and Extracurricular Lessons
보기4: ④ Child Welfare Act

문제: 304. Which of the following explanations regarding school zones is NOT correct?
보기1: ① School zones are subject to 12 items of the Act on Special Cases Concerning the Settlement of Traffic Accidents.
보기2: ② The driving speed of motor vehicles, etc. may be restricted to 30 kilometers per hour or below in a school zone.
보기3: ③ The amount of demerit points and fines are three times the penalties for general roads.
보기4: ④ Stopping or parking is allowed in a child protection zone that is not designated as an area where stopping or parking is prohibited.

문제: 305. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following children is not walking in a safe manner?
보기1: ① A child walking on the edge of a roadway that is clearly separated from the sidewalk
보기2: ② A child walking on the edge of a one-way road while facing the oncoming traffic
보기3: ③ A child walking on the edge of a roadway that does not have a clear separation from the sidewalk while facing the oncoming traffic
보기4: ④ A child walking on the right-hand side of a sidewalk

문제: 306. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following explanations regarding the protection of children is NOT correct?
보기1: ① If a child is crossing a road without a crosswalk, drivers must drive slowly.
보기2: ② If a child is standing in a safety zone, drivers must drive slowly while maintaining a safe distance.
보기3: ③ If a child is walking in a narrow alley, drivers must drive slowly while maintaining a safe distance.
보기4: ④ If a child is crossing a crosswalk, drivers shall make a temporary stop in front of the crosswalk.

문제: 307. Which of the following is correct regarding the driver's duty to protect school buses for children under the Road Traffic Act?
보기1: ① If a school bus for children with a red flasher being operated passes next to your lane, it is necessary to stop temporarily.
보기2: ② You cannot overtake any school bus for children passing on the road.
보기3: ③ If you violate this duty, you will incur 15 demerit points on your driver's license.
보기4: ④ This duty is excluded when a school bus for children with a red flasher operating stops on a double lane.

문제: 308. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is a case subject to punishment of a child's guardian?
보기1: ① A guardian who lets a child ride a bicycle on the driveway
보기2: ② A guardian who lets a child ride an electric scooter in a playground
보기3: ③ A guardian who lets a child ride an electric scooter on the vehicle road
보기4: ④ A guardian who lets a child ride a bicycle in a playground

문제: 309. According to the Act on the Aggravated Punishment of Specific Crimes, which of the following is true about the punishment imposed on the driver who causes bodily harm to a child in a school zone?
보기1: ① Imprisonment with labor not less than 1 year or not exceeding 15 years or a fine not less than KRW 5 million or not exceeding KRW 30 million
보기2: ② Imprisonment with labor (or for an indefinite term) for not less than 5 years
보기3: ③ Imprisonment with labor not exceeding 2 years or a fine not exceeding KRW 5 million
보기4: ④ Imprisonment with labor not exceeding 5 years or a fine not exceeding KRW 20 million

문제: 310. Which of the following is NOT correct regarding the duty of an operator who deals with a school bus for children?
보기1: ① When getting children on the school bus, an adult guardian must be designated.
보기2: ② An adult guardian must accompany the children getting on the school bus and a child protection sign must be attached to the bus.
보기3: ③ It is necessary to prepare and keep a record of seat belt wearing and confirmation of the accompanying guardian.
보기4: ④ A record of confirmation of wearing seat belts and accompanying guardians must be submitted to the supervisory authority of the facility operating the school bus every quarter.

문제: 311. Which of the following is the punishment imposed on the operator when “accompanying guardian sign” is attached even though there is no adult guardian on a school bus for children?
보기1: ① A fine of up to 200,000 won or detention
보기2: ② A fine of up to 300,000 won or detention
보기3: ③ A fine of up to 400,000 won or detention
보기4: ④ A fine of up to 500,000 won or detention

문제: 312. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is an area designated to protect the elderly from the risk of traffic accidents?
보기1: ① Aged person protection zone
보기2: ② Elderly welfare zone
보기3: ③ Protection area for older persons
보기4: ④ Elderly safety zone

문제: 313. Which of the following is NOT an authority a commissioner of City/Do police agency or a police chief can exercise in a protection area for older persons?
보기1: ① Prohibiting or restricting the passage of vehicles and horses
보기2: ② Designating and operating a back road as a one-way street.
보기3: ③ Setting a speed limit of 30 km/h for horses and vehicles
보기4: ④ Designating an on-road parking lot for the elderly on a road next to the gate of a house

문제: 314. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following may be prohibited to enter or drive in a silver zone?
보기1: ① PMDs and trams
보기2: ② Truck-mounted drilling rigs and kick scooters for children
보기3: ③ Motorcycles and rollators
보기4: ④ Road stabilizers and walking frames

문제: 315. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is true about a violation that took place in a silver zone at 10 AM?
보기1: ① If the driver of a dump truck violates the traffic signal, the fine is KRW 130,000.
보기2: ② If the driver of a passenger vehicle obstructs a senior pedestrian, the fine is KRW 70,000.
보기3: ③ If a bicycle rider obstructs a senior pedestrian crossing a crosswalk, the fine is KRW 50,000.
보기4: ④ If the driver of a cultivator fails to fulfill his/her duty of guaranteeing pedestrian safety, the fine is KRW 30,000.

문제: 316. Which of the following is NOT an area in which a mayor or public official can designate a protection area for older persons?
보기1: ① High school
보기2: ② Senior citizen welfare center
보기3: ③ Urban park
보기4: ④ Public gymnasium

문제: 317. Which of the following officials can NOT declare a protection area for older persons?
보기1: ① Mayor of a special metropolitan city
보기2: ② Mayor of a metropolitan city
보기3: ③ Governor of a special self-governing province
보기4: ④ A commissioner of City/Do police agency

문제: 318. Which of the following is true about the general characteristics of senior citizens who are considered people with mobility impairments?
보기1: ① Their reflexes are slow but quick in making decisions from experience.
보기2: ② They have poor eyesight but high hearing sensitivity.
보기3: ③ They may not be quick in responding to unexpected situations, but their cognitive ability is heightened in such cases.
보기4: ④ They lose mobility as their health conditions deteriorate.

문제: 319. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is true about the measures a mayor can take for a silver zone?
보기1: ① The mayor can restrict or prohibit the access of motor vehicles and horses and trams.
보기2: ② The mayor can prohibit the access of buses, but cannot restrict the access of trams.
보기3: ③ The mayor can prohibit the access of two-wheeled vehicles, but cannot restrict the access of bicycles.
보기4: ④ The mayor can prohibit the access of heavy equipment, but cannot restrict them.

문제: 320. The driver of a passenger car slammed on the brakes after spotting an elderly person crossing a crosswalk without pedestrian signal lights, but unfortunately hit him/her and he/she was hospitalized for two weeks. Which TWO of the following statements are correct?
보기1: ① The driver is not responsible at all as there were no pedestrian signal lights.
보기2: ② The driver is subject to civil liability.
보기3: ③ Only the elderly person is subject to criminal prosecution for their illegal crossing.
보기4: ④ The driver is subject to criminal liability.

문제: 321. Which TWO of the following are applicable to the control that a police chief has over a protection area for older persons?
보기1: ① Prohibition or restriction of vehicle passage
보기2: ② Prohibition of stopping/parking
보기3: ③ Installation of a road parking lot
보기4: ④ Prohibition or restriction of pedestrian passage

문제: 322. Which of the following is the correct method to drive when passing by an elderly person in a protection area for older persons?
보기1: ① Maintain a constant speed and drive by.
보기2: ② Maintain a safe distance and drive by slowly.
보기3: ③ Sound the horn and drive by quickly.
보기4: ④ Flash the headlights and drive by.

문제: 323. Which of the following is NOT the road facility that can be installed for the safety of the aged in the protection area for older persons?
보기1: ① Non-slip facilities, crash barriers
보기2: ② Speed bumps, non-slip facilities
보기3: ③ Acceleration lane, silver zone sign
보기4: ④ Crash barriers, road reflector system

문제: 324. Which of the following is NOT a safety precaution to be taken by a driver driving through a protection area for older persons at night?
보기1: ① Watch out for glare from other car’s headlights as you may not be able to see the pedestrians.
보기2: ② Drive at a high speed because there are no elderly people around at night.
보기3: ③ Drive through while looking out for any elderly crossing the road illegally.
보기4: ④ Drive carefully because elderly people wearing black can be hard to spot.

문제: 325. Which of the following is not true about driving across a crosswalk with a traffic light in a silver zone and the penalty for violation?
보기1: ① When the traffic light turns green, the driver of a motor vehicle must look around first and speed up slowly.
보기2: ② If the driver of a passenger vehicle violates the traffic signal between 8 AM and 8 PM, the fine is KRW 120,000.
보기3: ③ A bicycle rider must also wait for all senior pedestrians to finish crossing the street.
보기4: ④ If the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle obstructs the pedestrians between 8 AM and 8 PM, the fine is KRW 90,000.

문제: 326. Which of the following statements about a protection area for older persons is INCORRECT?
보기1: ① A fine is imposed for speeding between 8 a.m. and 8 p.m.
보기2: ② Green lights for pedestrians are longer.
보기3: ③ No road parking lots can be installed.
보기4: ④ Larger traffic lights are installed for better recognition by the elderly.

문제: 327. How many demerit points does the driver of a passenger car incur if caught driving at a speed over the limit of 25 km/h in a protection area for older persons at around 11 a.m.?
보기1: ① 60 points
보기2: ② 40 points
보기3: ③ 30 points
보기4: ④ 15 points

문제: 328. Which of the following is an INCORRECT method to drive when approaching a crosswalk with traffic lights in a protection area for older persons?
보기1: ① If an elderly person crosses the road after the signals change, wait for the person to finish crossing before taking off.
보기2: ② Be ready to take off instantly while anticipating the change of signal.
보기3: ③ Drive slowly to come to a safe stop when the signals change.
보기4: ④ Take extra precaution as the elderly walk at a slower pace.

문제: 329. Which of the following is INCORRECT about the measures applicable to the protection area for older persons?
보기1: ① The speed limit can be set to 30 km/h.
보기2: ② A 'caution' sign can be installed as the duration of the pedestrian signal is the same as that of the normal pedestrian signal.
보기3: ③ Extra traffic safety installations e.g. speed bumps can be added.
보기4: ④ The installation and management of traffic signals at the crosswalk of a main road located close to the main entrance of a protected facility can be prioritized.

문제: 330. Which of the following is NOT a behavior for which a fine is imposed when it occurs in a protection area for older persons between 8 a.m. and 8 p.m.?
보기1: ① Violation of traffic signal
보기2: ② Violation of parking rules
보기3: ③ Obstruction of pedestrians in a crosswalk
보기4: ④ Invasion of the center line

문제: 331. Which of the following is not true about a silver zone?
보기1: ① When driving in a silver zone, look around with caution for any potential hazards.
보기2: ② A silver zone sign is a road sign that informs drivers of their duty to protect the seniors within the designated zone.
보기3: ③ A silver zone sign is installed in the center of the road within the said zone.
보기4: ④ If the driver of a passenger vehicle obstructs a pedestrian crossing a crosswalk in a silver zone at 10 AM, the fine is KRW 120,000.

문제: 332. According to the Road Traffic Act, which one of the following statements regarding a protection area for older persons is NOT correct?
보기1: ① The rights to designate and manage a protection area for the older persons are vested in mayors of cities, etc.
보기2: ② A certain section may be designated as a protection area for the older persons in order to protect senior citizens.
보기3: ③ The passage of motor vehicles and horses may be restricted in a protection area for the older persons.
보기4: ④ The passage of motor vehicles and horses cannot be prohibited in a protection area for the older persons.

문제: 333. Which of the following pedestrian is complying with the Road Traffic Act?
보기1: ① A pedestrian who crosses a road without a crosswalk using the shortest possible distance.
보기2: ② A pedestrian who crosses a road without using a crosswalk, as there are no cars passing by.
보기3: ③ A pedestrian who crosses a road behind a stopped truck.
보기4: ④ A pedestrian who walks on the left side of a sidewalk

문제: 334. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is the driving behavior of an elderly driver that is subject to the highest demerit points?
보기1: ① Stop the car at the crosswalk and obstruct the passage of pedestrians.
보기2: ② Notice a pedestrian late and put on the brake so suddenly that the pedestrian almost fell.
보기3: ③ Upon finding a pedestrian who is jaywalking, sound the horn and pass quickly in front of the pedestrian.
보기4: ④ Overtake the pedestrian by crossing the solid yellow center line.

문제: 335. Which of the following persons is not regarded as a 'mobility disadvantaged person' according to the Act on Promotion of the Transportation Convenience of Mobility Disadvantaged Persons?
보기1: ① A child
보기2: ② A senior citizen
보기3: ③ A teenager
보기4: ④ A pregnant woman

문제: 336. Which of the following is not correct regarding the general physical characteristics of a senior citizen?
보기1: ① Slow movement
보기2: ② Vision deteriorates, but hearing improves.
보기3: ③ Slow Reflexes
보기4: ④ Physical strength is weakened.

문제: 337. Which of the following is the most desirable driving behavior of an elderly driver?
보기1: ① Drive a vehicle slowly for safety in case of traveling long distances.
보기2: ② Drive a vehicle without taking a rest until you reach your destination to save time.
보기3: ③ Keep an eye on the road situation and drive by complying with the speed limit.
보기4: ④ Drive mainly at night when there is less traffic.

문제: 338. Which of the following is the least related to safe driving by a senior citizen?
보기1: ① Taking sufficient rest prior to driving
보기2: ② Periodic checks of health condition
보기3: ③ Verification of the route to the destination prior to driving
보기4: ④ Driving at night

문제: 339. Which of the following is NOT the correct explanation regarding criminal punishment if a driver of a passenger car causes an injury which will take 3 weeks to heal on an elderly person in the protection area for the older persons?
보기1: ① If a driver has comprehensive insurance, he/she is not subject to criminal punishment.
보기2: ② Criminal punishment can be imposed only when there is a safety sign indicating the protection area for the older persons.
보기3: ③ If a victim does not want punishment, a driver is not subject to criminal punishment.
보기4: ④ If both parties reach an agreement, criminal punishment is not imposed.

문제: 340. Which ONE of the following is in the correct range of fines and penalties (excluding surcharges) imposed on a car driver who drives above 60 km/h at around 15
보기1: ① 60,000 won, 60 points
보기2: ② 90,000 won, 60 points
보기3: ③ 120,000 won, 120 points
보기4: ④ 150,000 won, 120 points

문제: 341. Which of the following is not a correct statement regarding parking spaces reserved for persons with disabilities?
보기1: ① A vehicle with a tag permitting parking in parking spaces reserved for persons with disabilities may park there even if a disabled person is not riding in the vehicle.
보기2: ② If a person issued with a tag permitting parking in parking spaces reserved for persons with disabilities uses it in an unlawful manner such as transfer or lending, the tag may be confiscated or reissue may be restricted.
보기3: ③ Any act that impedes parking in parking spaces reserved for persons with disabilities, such as piling up items or blocking passage is strictly prohibited.
보기4: ④ When a vehicle without a parking tag is parked in parking spaces reserved for persons with disabilities, a fine of KRW 100,000 is imposed.

문제: 342. Which of the following is not an agency that issues a parking tag for parking spaces reserved for persons with disabilities?
보기1: ① Ministry of Patriots and Veterans Affairs
보기2: ② The Special Self-Governing City Mayor, the Special Self-Governing Province Governor,
보기3: ③ Head of a Si/Gun/Gu
보기4: ④ Minister of Health and Welfare

문제: 343. Which of the following lights must be turned on when stopping on a road at night (except for two-wheeled vehicles)?
보기1: ① Headlights and taillights
보기2: ② Indoor lights and sidelights
보기3: ③ License plate lights and headlights
보기4: ④ Taillights and sidelights

문제: 344. Which of the following descriptions is most correct about the yellow broken line on the edge of a road?
보기1: ① Both parking and stopping are allowed on the edge of a road marked with yellow broken lines.
보기2: ② Parking is banned but stopping is allowed on the edge of a road marked with yellow broken lines.
보기3: ③ Parking is allowed but stopping is banned on the edge of a road marked with yellow broken lines.
보기4: ④ Both parking and stopping are banned on the edge of a road marked with yellow broken lines.

문제: 345. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is not true about idling and parking restrictions for a PMD?
보기1: ① An area located within 10 m from the edge of an intersection or an area located within 5 m from the corner of a road
보기2: ② An area located within 10 m from a crosswalk or an area located within 10 m from the edge of a railway crossing
보기3: ③ An area located within 10 m from any side of a safety zone or an area located within 10 m from bus stop columns
보기4: ④ An area located within 5 m from a place where emergency firefighting equipment is installed or an area located within 5 m from a fire extinguishing water supply system

문제: 346. What is the penalty for parking a non-electric vehicle in the charging area of an eco-friendly vehicle?
보기1: ① 30,000 won
보기2: ② 50,000 won
보기3: ③ 70,000 won

문제: 347. Which of the following terms refers to the practice in which drivers and passengers open the car door using the far hand rather than the hand closer to the door?
보기1: ① Dutch Reach
보기2: ② Other hand
보기3: ③ Looking back
보기4: ④ Looking side

문제: 348. How long can an electric vehicle (EV) or a plug-in hybrid vehicle park at a charging station?
보기1: ① 1 hour
보기2: ② 2 hours
보기3: ③ 3 hours
보기4: ④ 4 hours

문제: 349. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is true about idling or parking on a hill?
보기1: ① Park downhill and use wheel chocks or rocks and put them under the wheels to make sure that the vehicle does not move. Parking on a steeply inclined area is prohibited.
보기2: ② Turn the steering system away from the curb, facing toward the edge of the opposite side of the road. Idling on a hill is prohibited.
보기3: ③ If a driver is in the driver's seat, he/she must turn the steering system away from the curb. Inevitably idling due to vehicle malfunction is not considered parking.
보기4: ④ When parking on a hill other than a road, turn the steering system toward the curb, facing the edge of the driver's nearest side of the road. A vehicle that stays in the same place for 5 minutes is considered idling.

문제: 350. Which one of the following is the correct amount of fine imposed on those who stack objects or obstruct the entry to parking spaces reserved for persons with disabilities?
보기1: ① KRW 40,000

문제: 351. Which TWO of the following statements correctly describe how a driver should behave?
보기1: ① The passenger is responsible for their safety when exiting the vehicle.
보기2: ② The engine must be turned off when stopping briefly to make a quick purchase.
보기3: ③ Before exiting a vehicle, the driver must turn off the engine and check that it is safe.
보기4: ④ When parking in an area other than a parking lot, the parking brake must be left released so that the vehicle can be moved if necessary.

문제: 352. Which TWO of the following are the safest methods to park on a steeply sloped road?
보기1: ① Only apply the vehicle’s parking brake.
보기2: ② Turn the steering wheel towards the edge of the road (the side closest to the vehicle).
보기3: ③ Place a wooden wedge behind a wheel in the downhill direction of the slope to prevent sliding of the vehicle.
보기4: ④ For a vehicle using manual transmission, shift the gear into the neutral position.

문제: 353. Which TWO of the following statements about stopping/parking are correct?
보기1: ① When stopping on a road, pull over the vehicle to the right edge of the road.
보기2: ② There is no need to follow the stopping/parking instructions shown on safety signs.
보기3: ③ When parking a manual transmission vehicle on a flat surface, all you need to do is leave the vehicle in first or reverse gear.
보기4: ④ A wooden wedge must be placed under a wheel on a sloped road.

문제: 354. Which TWO of the following account for parking?
보기1: ① A vehicle remaining stationary after breaking down
보기2: ② A temporary stop after recognizing a safety hazard
보기3: ③ A stopped vehicle that is left unattended by the driver so that it cannot be driven immediately, even if it is for less than five minutes
보기4: ④ Stopping briefly near a subway station to drop a friend

문제: 355. Which TWO of the following account for stopping?
보기1: ① A taxi remaining stopped at a taxi stand to pick up passengers
보기2: ② A vehicle that is left unattended by its driver who is away to pick up a load to transport
보기3: ③ A vehicle stopped at a red light
보기4: ④ A vehicle stopped to ask a passerby for directions

문제: 356. According to the Road Traffic Act, which TWO of the following locations allow a motor vehicle to make a stop or park?
보기1: ① Within 50 meters from the main entrance in a school zone
보기2: ② Within 10 meters from a crosswalk
보기3: ③ Within a distance of 5 meters from where emergency fire extinguishing equipment is installed
보기4: ④ Within 10 meters from a safety zone in all four directions

문제: 357. According to the Road Traffic Act, which TWO of the following locations allow a motor vehicle to park?
보기1: ① 5 meters from the corner of a road
보기2: ② At a distance of 7 meters or more from where a fire extinguishing water facility is installed
보기3: ③ At a distance of 7 meters or more from where emergency fire extinguishing equipment is installed
보기4: ④ 5 meters from a safety zone

문제: 358. At an intersection with no traffic control, what is the safest method to turn left?
보기1: ① Drive slowly and make a left turn with caution even if there are other vehicles that have entered the intersection ahead of you.
보기2: ② Yield to cars entering from wider roads.
보기3: ③ Yield to cars passing through straight across, but take the right of way over cars trying to turn right.
보기4: ④ Go slowly along the centerline of the road beforehand and make a left turn using the outside center of the intersection.

문제: 359. Which one of the following INCORRECTLY describes a safe method to use a roundabout?
보기1: ① Slow down before entering a roundabout.
보기2: ② Stop temporarily at the yield line and enter slowly.
보기3: ③ A vehicle entering the roundabout has the right of way, and the vehicle making a turn in the roundabout must yield.
보기4: ④ Turn counterclockwise.

문제: 360. A vehicle that has entered an intersection without traffic lights ahead of you is making a left turn, what should you do?
보기1: ① Proceed with caution if you are going to pass straight through.
보기2: ② If you are going to turn right, make a right turn at low speed.
보기3: ③ If you are going to go straight through or make a right turn, yield to vehicles making left turns.
보기4: ④ If you are driving on a narrow road, pass through the intersection at low speed.

문제: 361. Which of the following is the most appropriate method to make a left turn at an intersection?
보기1: ① Drive slowly along the center line, and make a left turn using the inside of the intersection center.
보기2: ② Drive at high speed along the center line, and make a left turn using the inside of the intersection center.
보기3: ③ Drive at high speed along the center line, and make a left turn using the outside of the intersection center.
보기4: ④ Proceed slowly along the center line, and make a left turn in a way that is comfortable for the driver.

문제: 362. Which of the following is the proper method to pass through an intersection without traffic control?
보기1: ① Drive slowly when it is impossible to check the sides.
보기2: ② A vehicle turning left has the right of way over a vehicle traveling straight.
보기3: ③ A vehicle turning right has the right of way over a vehicle traveling straight.
보기4: ④ You should drive slowly when the intersection is wider than the road you are on.

문제: 363. Which of the following locations requires the installation of a roundabout to facilitate traffic efficiency and safety?
보기1: ① A location where accidents are frequently caused by vehicles traveling straight or turning in an intersection
보기2: ② A location where one or more roads meeting at an intersection has three lanes or more in each direction
보기3: ③ A location where the volume of traffic flow through a roundabout exceeds its capacity
보기4: ④ A location where the signal coordination effect among the relevant sections decreases if a roundabout is constructed

문제: 364. Which of the following statements correctly describes a roundabout?
보기1: ① Roundabouts have more conflicting points than signalized intersections.
보기2: ② Vehicles must wait at the yield line until there is room in the roundabout.
보기3: ③ Traffic lights are installed at a roundabout to guide vehicles and facilitate traffic flow through the intersection.
보기4: ④ A vehicle that has already entered a roundabout must yield to an entering vehicle.

문제: 365. What is the term used to refer to the road surface markings of white broken lines that are designed to guide left turns at intersections?
보기1: ① Turn lines
보기2: ② Extension lines
보기3: ③ Instruction lines
보기4: ④ Regulation lines

문제: 366. Which TWO of the following are correct methods to make a safe left turn at an intersection?
보기1: ① Watch for vehicles from the opposite direction that are stopping.
보기2: ② Watch for vehicles from the opposite direction that are turning right.
보기3: ③ Watch for vehicles from the same direction that are turning right.
보기4: ④ Watch for vehicles in the lane to your side that are also turning left.

문제: 367. Which TWO of the following are the safest methods to make a left/right turn at an intersection?
보기1: ① To make a right turn, take the rightmost lane of the road and turn right slowly.
보기2: ② To make a left turn on a congested road, disregard the turn lines on the left and drive quickly.
보기3: ③ To make a left turn, drive slowly along the center line and turn left along the inner part of the intersection.
보기4: ④ To make a left turn at an intersection marked with turn lines, turn with the left tires passing through the inside of the turn lines.

문제: 368. Which of the following is a correct guideline with regard to passing through a roundabout?
보기1: ① A car inside the roundabout has the right of way.
보기2: ② A car about to enter the roundabout has the right of way.
보기3: ③ A car exiting the roundabout has the right of way.
보기4: ④ There are no set rules on who has the right of way.

문제: 369. Which of the following is NOT prohibited at a roundabout?
보기1: ① Stopping
보기2: ② Parking
보기3: ③ Driving slowly and stopping temporarily
보기4: ④ Overtaking

문제: 370. Which of the following represents a turning vehicle for which the right of way is guaranteed at a roundabout?
보기1: ① Vehicles moving on the section of road within the roundabout
보기2: ② Vehicles trying to turn left before entering the roundabout
보기3: ③ Vehicles trying to turn right before entering the roundabout
보기4: ④ Vehicles trying to turn left or right before entering the roundabout

문제: 371. Which of the following is an INCORRECT guideline on how to use roundabouts?
보기1: ① Vehicles must approach the roundabout slowly.
보기2: ② A car inside the roundabout has the right of way.
보기3: ③ Vehicles may continually enter the roundabout as there are no signals.
보기4: ④ Turn clockwise in the roundabout.

문제: 372. Which TWO of the following are correct methods to pass through a roundabout?
보기1: ① Temporarily stop before entering the roundabout, and enter if there are no vehicles approaching from the left.
보기2: ② Turn clockwise in the roundabout.
보기3: ③ There is no need to operate turn signals when entering/exiting the roundabout.
보기4: ④ Once you are in the roundabout, continue to drive without stopping if possible.

문제: 373. Which of the following is a place where you should stop temporarily while driving?
보기1: ① Near a curve in a road
보기2: ② Descent on a steep slope
보기3: ③ Near the top of a slope
보기4: ④ At an intersection with no traffic control and heavy traffic

문제: 374. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is a place where you should stop temporarily?
보기1: ① An intersection without a traffic control officer where traffic to the left and right cannot be checked
보기2: ② An intersection where the lights have turned green
보기3: ③ A busy bridge or tunnel
보기4: ④ In the vicinity of a curve or the highest point on a slope

문제: 375. Which of the following is a place where you should stop temporarily pursuant to the Road Traffic Act?
보기1: ① Inside a tunnel and on a bridge
보기2: ② At a busy intersection with no traffic light
보기3: ③ On a descending section of a steep hill
보기4: ④ A curved section of a road

문제: 376. Which of the following is NOT correct regarding the variable speed limit section?
보기1: ① It is an active system that changes the regulated speed in accordance with the situation.
보기2: ② It uses an electric sign that can display different speeds by changing the numbers.
보기3: ③ When the maximum speed is set with a variable speed limit sign, it must be followed.
보기4: ④ When the maximum speed determined by the variable speed limit sign and the maximum speed of the safety sign show different values, the maximum speed indicated by the safety sign must be followed.

문제: 377. According to the Road Traffic Act, the driver of ( ) must ( ) in front of a railway crossing and then pass through it after confirming that it is safe to cross. Which of the following best fills the parentheses?
보기1: ① any vehicle - slow down
보기2: ② any motor vehicle or heavy equipment - slow down
보기3: ③ any vehicle or tank - stop
보기4: ④ any vehicle or tram - stop

문제: 378. Which of the following is the safest method to drive at an expressway interchange?
보기1: ① As interchanges tend to be congested, apply sudden brakes to discourage vehicles behind you from following closely and thereby prevent potential accidents.
보기2: ② As drivers tend to become less aware of speed at an interchange, stop momentarily before you continue.
보기3: ③ If the desired interchange has already been passed, use the next interchange.
보기4: ④ Accelerate quickly to enter an interchange.

문제: 379. Which of the following is the most correct action to take when a drive of the vehicle ahead stretches his arm horizontally out of the left side of the vehicle?
보기1: ① Slow down as the front vehicle is expected to turn right.
보기2: ② Change course to an upper lane as the vehicle is expected to cross.
보기3: ③ Overtake the vehicle as the front vehicle is expected to make a U-turn.
보기4: ④ Slow down as the front vehicle is expected to change lanes.

문제: 380. Which of the following hand signals is used to indicate your intent to turn right?
보기1: ① Extend your left arm out to the left and bend your forearm vertically upward.
보기2: ② Extend your left arm out to the left, parallel to the road.
보기3: ③ Extend your right arm out to the right and hold it parallel to the road and wave the extended arm forwards and backwards.
보기4: ④ Stick your left arm out of the vehicle and bend your forearm downward at an angle of 45°.

문제: 381. As a vehicle is about to enter an intersection according to the traffic light, a police officer gives a hand signal to stop. In this scenario, which of the following is the safest way to drive?
보기1: ① Stop just before the stop line.
보기2: ② Decelerate suddenly to slow down.
보기3: ③ Proceed according to the signal from the traffic light.
보기4: ④ Enter the intersection slowly.

문제: 382. When there is a yellow broken line alongside a yellow solid line in the middle of a road, which of the following is correct about overtaking?
보기1: ① Overtaking is not allowed from either the yellow broken line or the yellow solid line.
보기2: ② Overtaking is allowed from the side of the yellow broken line.
보기3: ③ Overtaking is allowed from the sides of both the yellow broken line and the yellow solid line if it’s clear that it’s safe.
보기4: ④ Overtaking is allowed from the side of the yellow solid line.

문제: 383. Which of the following is the correct method to drive through a railway crossing?
보기1: ① Drive through if there are no trains coming.
보기2: ② Come to a stop, check that it is safe, and drive through.
보기3: ③ Drive through at a speed above the speed limit.
보기4: ④ Drive at an increased speed if the crossing gate is about to close.

문제: 384. Which of the following is the correct method to make a left turn?
보기1: ① Turn on the left turn signal at least 30m (100m on expressways) away from where you want to make a left turn.
보기2: ② Turn on the left turn signal at least 10m (100m on expressways) away from where you want to make a left turn.
보기3: ③ Turn on the left turn signal at least 20m (80m on expressways) away from where you want to make a left turn.
보기4: ④ Turn on the left turn signal when you reach the location where you want to make a left turn.

문제: 385. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is not a correct statement regarding the speed of motor vehicles, etc.?
보기1: ① Separate legal speed limits are applied to various roads depending on whether it is a general road, exclusive road for motor vehicles, or an expressway, and on the total number of lanes.
보기2: ② There are no minimum speed limits on regular roads.
보기3: ③ You must drive at a reduced speed in poor weather conditions.
보기4: ④ If the speed limit set by the variable speed limit sign and the speed limit set by the speed limit safety sign are different, the latter must be followed.

문제: 386. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is not a correct statement regarding the speed of motor vehicles, etc.?
보기1: ① Speed limits are set because the likelihood of traffic accidents increases at higher vehicle speeds.
보기2: ② Minimum speed limits are set to maintain the efficiency of vehicle-only lanes and expressways.
보기3: ③ Provisional speed limits can be set by the commissioner general of the Korean National Police Agency, or the commissioner of City/Do police agency for road safety and efficiency.
보기4: ④ For the setting of speed limits on expressways, the commissioner of City/Do police agency has jurisdiction; for all other roads, the commissioner general of the Korean National Police Agency has jurisdiction.

문제: 387. Which TWO of the following constitute a violation of traffic signal?
보기1: ① Stopping over the stop line at a red light
보기2: ② Entering an intersection when the lights have already turned yellow
보기3: ③ Driving through carefully when the lights are flashing yellow
보기4: ④ Stopping temporarily in front of the stop line when the lights are blinking red, before driving through carefully

문제: 388. When making a right turn at the intersection of a six-lane (three lanes in each direction) road, which TWO of the following are the correct methods to proceed?
보기1: ① When making a right turn, switch on the direction indicator right before the intersection to inform others of the direction in which you will proceed.
보기2: ② Even if the signal for pedestrians in the crosswalk of the street to the right is green, you can pass through it when there are no pedestrians in the crosswalk.
보기3: ③ If a supplementary signal for vehicles at the crosswalk is red, you cannot pass even if there are no pedestrians.
보기4: ④ It is safe to make a right turn using the second lane of a six-lane (three lanes in each direction) road.

문제: 389. According to the Motor Vehicle Management Act, which of the following are true about the criteria for a van or bus and the precautions when making a left turn behind a van or bus? (Select two answers)
보기1: ① A bus refers to a vehicle with a seating capacity of 36 or more persons. When you are driving behind a bus, you must drive slowly, keeping a safe distance from the bus so that you can see the traffic lights.
보기2: ② A mini-bus refers to a vehicle with a seating capacity of between 16 and 35 persons. When you are driving behind a mini-bus and the mini-bus driver turns on a turn signal, slow down and catch up to the mini-bus so that other vehicles won't cut in front of you.
보기3: ③ A van refers to a vehicle with a seating capacity of 15 or fewer persons. Since vans are more prone to overturning due to their high center of gravity compared to passenger vehicles, you must keep a safe distance from them.
보기4: ④ A light van refers to a vehicle with an engine displacement below 1,200 cc. Although light vans have the same center of gravity as passenger vehicles, you must keep a safe distance from them.

문제: 390. Which TWO of the following correctly describe how to change lanes?
보기1: ① Change lanes while maintaining speed if the car behind you in the lane you are about to enter is far back enough.
보기2: ② Slow down when you change lanes if the car behind you in the lane you are about to enter is far back enough.
보기3: ③ Let the car behind you in the lane you are about to enter pass if it is approaching.
보기4: ④ Change your lane quickly if the car behind you in the lane you are about to enter is approaching.

문제: 391. Which TWO of the following statements about the lines that separate lanes are correct?
보기1: ① Where a solid line and a broken line run parallel, you cannot change from the lane near the solid-line to the lane near the broken-line.
보기2: ② Where a solid line and a broken line run parallel, you can change from the lane near the solid-line to the lane near the broken-line.
보기3: ③ Where a solid line and a broken line run parallel, you cannot change from the lane near the broken-line to the lane near the solid-line.
보기4: ④ Where a solid line and a broken line run parallel, you can change from the lane near the broken-line to the lane near the solid-line.

문제: 392. According to the Road Traffic Act, what does a flashing red light indicate?
보기1: ① Vehicles and horses must drive slowly while looking out for traffic.
보기2: ② Vehicles and horses may proceed while looking out for traffic.
보기3: ③ Vehicles and horses may reverse while looking out for safety signs.
보기4: ④ Vehicles and horses must temporarily stop right before the stop line and then proceed while looking out for traffic.

문제: 393. Which of the following instructions about an intersection with an unprotected left-turn sign is correct?
보기1: ① You can turn left regardless of the signal as long as you look out for traffic.
보기2: ② You can turn left at a red light while looking out for traffic.
보기3: ③ You can turn left at a green light while looking out for traffic.
보기4: ④ You can turn left at a yellow light while looking out for traffic.

문제: 394. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is a correct statement regarding the speed of motor vehicles?
보기1: ① The minimum speed limit on expressways is 50 km/h.
보기2: ② Vehicle-only lanes have a maximum speed limit, but no minimum speed limit.
보기3: ③ There are maximum and minimum speed limits on normal roads.
보기4: ④ The maximum speed limit on expressways with more than two lanes in each direction is the same for all types of vehicles.

문제: 395. Which of the following is a correct statement about overtaking?
보기1: ① You can overtake a vehicle that is in the process of overtaking another vehicle.
보기2: ② You must overtake on the right when in a tunnel.
보기3: ③ Overtaking on a road with one lane in each direction is only permitted in an area with solid yellow lines.
보기4: ④ Overtaking is prohibited in intersections.

문제: 396. Which of the following statements about the center line on a road is correct?
보기1: ① Overtaking is allowed if the center is marked with a yellow solid line.
보기2: ② The center line of a reversible lane is the leftmost yellow broken line in the direction of traffic indicated by traffic signals.
보기3: ③ A bus stopped on a provincial road with one lane in each direction is allowed to be overtaken by crossing the yellow solid center line.
보기4: ④ A center line can be installed on roads that are at least 4.75 m wide.

문제: 397. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following vehicles may drive along the second lane of a six-lane (three lanes in each direction) expressway?
보기1: ① Trucks
보기2: ② Special vehicles
보기3: ③ Vehicles fitted with construction equipment
보기4: ④ Small and mid-sized passenger vehicles

문제: 398. If it is necessary to drive in the first lane of a six-lane (three lanes in each direction) expressway at a speed of ( ) kilometers per hour or below due to an increased volume of traffic, etc., it is permissible to do so even when not overtaking another vehicle. Which of the following best fits in the brackets ( )?
399. Which of the following is true about using a freeway shoulder?
보기1: ① If drowsy while driving, you can pull over on the shoulder to take a rest.
보기2: ② You can park on the shoulder to appreciate a good sunrise.
보기3: ③ You can drive on the shoulder when the freeway is congested.
보기4: ④ The penalty for driving on the shoulder without a good cause is a fine of KRW60,000.

문제: 400. According to the standards regarding traffic by lane on an expressway (5 lanes in each direction), which of the following is to be used like the left lane? (There are no dedicated lanes or acceleration/deceleration lanes)
보기1: ① 1~2 lane
보기2: ② 2~3 lane
보기3: ③ 1~3 lane
보기4: ④ 2nd lane only

문제: 401. Which of the following is not true about freeway lanes? (Freeways with no bus-only lanes)
보기1: ① Lane 1 of a six-lane freeway can be used by passenger vehicles, light vans, vans, mini-buses and buses to overtake other vehicles.
보기2: ② You can use the lane on the left of the designated lane to overtake another vehicle.
보기3: ③ All vehicles can use the lane on the left of their respective designated lanes.
보기4: ④ The penalty for not using the designated lane for drivers of passenger vehicles is 10 points.

문제: 402. Which one of the following is INCORRECT regarding how a passenger car overtakes other vehicles on a six-lane (three lanes in each direction) expressway with smooth traffic?
보기1: ① To overtake, a passenger car changes to Lane 1 and continues in Lane 1.
보기2: ② A large passenger vehicle in Lane 3 changes to Lane 2 in order to overtake.
보기3: ③ A small passenger vehicle uses Lane 1 to overtake.
보기4: ④ A 5-ton truck uses Lane 2 to overtake.

문제: 403. Which of the following is an INCORRECT guideline for the use of the right traffic lanes on roadways?
보기1: ① All vehicles may use the right lane of the designated lane.
보기2: ② When a passenger car overtakes another vehicle, it shall use the lane to the immediate right of the lane designated by traffic standards.
보기3: ③ On an eight-lane (four lanes in each direction) general road, a passenger car may drive in any of the lanes.
보기4: ④ On an eight-lane (four lanes in each direction) expressway, a large truck is to use the lane on the right.

문제: 404. Which among the following is permitted to use the bus-only lane on a general roadway?
보기1: ① A 12-seater passenger vehicle carrying 6 passengers.
보기2: ② A passenger vehicle for domestic tourists that is transporting 25 tourists.
보기3: ③ A 12-seater commuter passenger vehicle carrying employees on designated routes.
보기4: ④ A taxi temporarily using the lane so that passengers can board/leave the taxi.

문제: 405. According to the Road Traffic Act a passenger car with 9 seats can take the bus lane on the highway if ( ) or more people are on the vehicle. Which of the following is correct?
보기1: ① 3
보기2: ② 4
보기3: ③ 5
보기4: ④ 6

문제: 406. Which of the following is the appropriate driving standard for a vehicle on a six-lane (three lanes in each direction) expressway? (There are no bus lanes)
보기1: ① Passenger cars are to use Lane 1 and therefore must use only Lane 1.
보기2: ② A small passenger vehicle, the designated lane for which is Lane 2, should use Lane 1 when overtaking.
보기3: ③ Large vans must use the first lane.
보기4: ④ A truck with a maximum load weight of 1.5 tons or less must drive in the Lane 1.

문제: 407. A passenger car is driving in the second lane of a six-lane (three lanes in each direction) expressway. Which lane can it use to overtake another vehicle?
보기1: ① First lane
보기2: ② Second lane
보기3: ③ Third lane
보기4: ④ Any of the above

문제: 408. Which of the following is NOT correct regarding overtaking?
보기1: ① To overtake another vehicle, you must pass on the left lane of the front vehicle.
보기2: ② If the center line is a yellow broken line, it is possible to overtake when there is no vehicle in the opposite direction.
보기3: ③ In case of reversible lane, overtaking is not allowed on the leftmost yellow broken line in the direction indicated by a traffic light.
보기4: ④ On the one-way 4-lane expressway, vehicles driving on the right lane can move up to the first lane.

문제: 409. The following are various guidelines for the passage of a vehicle depending on the lanes according to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree. Which one is NOT correct? (There are no bus lanes)
보기1: ① When proceeding at a slow speed, the driver may use the lane to the right of the current lane in which he/she has been driving.
보기2: ② The first lane of a four-lane (two lanes in each direction) expressway may be used by all motor vehicles to overtake.
보기3: ③ On a one-way traffic road, the rightmost lane is considered the first lane.
보기4: ④ The right lane of a six-lane (three lanes in each direction) expressway is to be used by a truck to drive.

문제: 410. Which of the following is correct regarding the standards for vehicles running on a one-way three-lane expressway (no bus-only lane)?
보기1: ① The first lane is the lane for overtaking a passenger car driving on the second lane.
보기2: ② The first lane is the driving lane for a van.
보기3: ③ The roadside is the driving road for emergency vehicles and tow vehicles.
보기4: ④ When operating a bus-only lane, the first lane is the driving road for trucks.

문제: 411. According to the definition provided by the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, which of the following is NOT a type of exclusive lane?
보기1: ① Exclusive lane for buses
보기2: ② Exclusive lane for high-occupancy vehicles
보기3: ③ Exclusive lane for motor vehicles
보기4: ④ Exclusive lane for bicycles

문제: 412. Which of the following most appropriately describes aquaplaning?
보기1: ① You must change tires with wider widths to reduce risks involved with aquaplaning.
보기2: ② Aquaplaning is more common in snow than rain. You must reduce speed.
보기3: ③ Tires with worn-down treads will experience less aquaplaning due to reduced traction.
보기4: ④ Under inflation can cause the tires to aquaplane more, especially at higher speeds.

문제: 413. Which of the following is the safe method to drive when a vehicle loses control on a frozen road?
보기1: ① Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is spinning.
보기2: ② In the case of a car with manual transmission, shift into high gear.
보기3: ③ Turn the steering wheel in the opposite direction.
보기4: ④ Stop the car using the parking brake.

문제: 414. Which of the following is the safest method of driving a vehicle on a foggy road?
보기1: ① On a curved road or at an intersection, honk to warn other vehicles to make way and proceed quickly.
보기2: ② In dense fog, keep the high-beam headlights on to secure visibility.
보기3: ③ On a foggy road, switch on the fog light only.
보기4: ④ When visibility is secured to some extent, drive slowly while checking the guardrail, center line, and traffic lane.

문제: 415. Which of the following is the safest method to stop on a snowy or icy road?
보기1: ① Apply the brake hard.
보기2: ② Stop quickly using the foot brake and the parking brake at the same time.
보기3: ③ Use the engine brake only to slow down until the car comes to a complete stop.
보기4: ④ After slowing down with the engine brake, step lightly on the brake pedal several times.

문제: 416. Which of the following is the most desirable attitude for a driver who drives through an underpass on a road in heavy rain?
보기1: ① All roads are well drained, so there are no danger factors.
보기2: ② Respond to risk factors while listening to disaster information such as disaster broadcasts and information boards.
보기3: ③ Take rest by stopping at the roadside of the underpass until heavy rain passes.
보기4: ④ Drive faster than the designated speed because high speed is required at that moment.

문제: 417. Which of the following is the most correct explanation of a frozen or icy road in winter?
보기1: ① It occurs mainly in tunnels, and the road surface becomes an icy road as the fog particles freeze.
보기2: ② Black ice often occurs on bridges, at tunnel entrances, and on shady roads.
보기3: ③ Black ice occurs when snow contaminated with vehicle fumes accumulates on the road surface.
보기4: ④ When passing through an icy road, reduce the speed as much as possible by not operating the steering wheel and braking suddenly.

문제: 418. Which of the following is not the right thing to do in case of an accident or fire in a tunnel?
보기1: ① Press the emergency bell situated in the tunnel or call 119.
보기2: ② If you are in the tunnel, continue driving to evacuate the tunnel.
보기3: ③ If you are unable to evacuate the tunnel, pull over on the shoulder or at the emergency parking area.
보기4: ④ When parking inside the tunnel, turn off the engine and promptly evacuate the tunnel.

문제: 419. Which of the following is the most appropriate action to take when the brakes are not working on a downhill road?
보기1: ① Turn the ignition off at once.
보기2: ② Jump out of the car after changing to a low gear.
보기3: ③ Reduce your speed by zigzagging.
보기4: ④ Run the car into a guard rail or a wall after reducing the speed by changing to a low gear.

문제: 420. If you witness a fire caused by a traffic accident while driving inside a tunnel, which of the following is the most appropriate method to respond?
보기1: ① It is safe to stop your vehicle even if traffic is still flowing.
보기2: ② If traffic is at a standstill, stop the vehicle and wait inside until the fire is extinguished.
보기3: ③ If traffic is at a standstill, stop the vehicle and leave the scene with your car keys.
보기4: ④ If there is a lot of smoke, bend low down to the ground and find the nearest emergency exit in the opposite direction of the smoke.

문제: 421. Which of the following is the correct explanation when driving on a sharp curve?
보기1: ① Drive through the curve at the same speed as that before entering the curve.
보기2: ② After entering a curve, it is better to increase the change gear ratio to reduce the centrifugal force.
보기3: ③ A rear-wheel drive vehicle may experience understeer on a curved road.
