보기4: ④ In order to reduce oversteer on a curved road, the steering wheel should be turned slightly in the opposite direction of the steering direction.

문제: 422. What do you call a problem that occurs when the brakes don't work due to bubbles that form in brake fluid overheated by excessive braking?
보기1: ① Standing wave
보기2: ② Vapor lock
보기3: ③ Road holding
보기4: ④ Under steering

문제: 423. Which of the following is not a proper way of driving in fog?
보기1: ① When driving around a curve or on a hill, use the vehicle horn.
보기2: ② If visibility in fog is less than 70 m, reduce speed to less than half of the speed limit.
보기3: ③ Try to maximize visibility by turning on fog lamps and high-beam headlights.
보기4: ④ Even in case of a vehicle failure or a minor accident, move the vehicle to the side of the road.

문제: 424. Which of the following is not a correct explanation of black ice in winter?
보기1: ① It is a phenomenon in which a thin ice film forms like a coating on the road surface.
보기2: ② It is a phenomenon in which pollutants in the air are mixed with snow and moisture on the asphalt surface, absorbed, and then frozen into black ice.
보기3: ③ It occurs mainly in places with low temperatures during the winter season, such as on bridges, tunnel entrances, shady roads, and in the shade of mountain corners.
보기4: ④ It refers to the phenomenon where the snow melts and seeps into the sunny road, and the black color of the road is reflected by sunlight and sparkles.

문제: 425. Which of the following is not true about icy roads during winter months?
보기1: ① Icy roads are more common on concrete roads than on asphalt.
보기2: ② Ice melts slower on asphalt roads than on concrete.
보기3: ③ The friction coefficient of an asphalt surface increases to 1.6 when dry.
보기4: ④ Under the same conditions, the road friction coefficients of frozen concrete and asphalt surfaces are equal.

문제: 426. Which of the following is the least appropriate measure for a driver to take when an earthquake occurs?
보기1: ① Increase your vehicle's speed and quickly pass through the area.
보기2: ② If it is impossible to move using a vehicle, park the vehicle to the side and take shelter.
보기3: ③ Be prepared to move the parked vehicle later by keeping the key in the ignition, and take shelter.
보기4: ④ Turn on the radio to listen to the disaster broadcast.

문제: 427. Which TWO of the following describe the correct method to drive in strong winds or storms?
보기1: ① Firmly hold the steering wheel with both hands and stay in your current lane.
보기2: ② Ignore the gusting winds and speed up.
보기3: ③ Park near a sign, traffic lights or a roadside tree.
보기4: ④ Be particularly careful in areas vulnerable to strong winds, such as mountainous areas, bridges, and tunnel exits.

문제: 428. Which TWO from the following are the most appropriate explanation regarding driving on a gravel road?
보기1: ① Hold the steering wheel as loosely as possible to minimize the impact on the arm.
보기2: ② Increase the speed while driving to make sure that the wheels are in contact with the road surface as much as possible.
보기3: ③ Slow down to make sure that gravel is not splashed onto pedestrians or other vehicles or horses.
보기4: ④ Slightly lower tire pressure is better for driving than the appropriate level of air pressure.

문제: 429. Two vehicles are driving in rain and the rear vehicle saw the front vehicle stopping and applied the brakes. Which of the following is not correct? (Select two answers)
보기1: ① Hard braking can cause the vehicle to nose dive due to increased friction between the road surface and tires.
보기2: ② Free running distance is increased due to reduced friction of the road surface.
보기3: ③ Aquaplaning and partial braking may occur simultaneously, causing the vehicle to slide out of the lane.
보기4: ④ The higher the tire wear rate, the shorter the braking distance.

문제: 430. A vehicle is approaching near the top of an uphill. Which TWO from the following are safe ways of driving?
보기1: ① Increase engine RPM (revolutions per minute) to reduce fuel consumption.
보기2: ② At the top of the uphill, be sure to stop temporarily before starting.
보기3: ③ Maintain a safe distance from the front vehicle.
보기4: ④ Drive in a lower gear than higher gear.

문제: 431. When you drive downhill, which TWO of the following are the safest methods to drive?
보기1: ① Only use the foot brake because shifting gears is not necessary.
보기2: ② If an emergency situation occurs, use the parking brake immediately.
보기3: ③ Use the same gear you used when driving up the slope.
보기4: ④ Use both the foot brake and engine brake properly.

문제: 432. Which of the following is the most correct behavior of a driver to prepare for the long-distance driving during the rainy season?
보기1: ① Replace the antifreeze with distilled water for use as engine coolant.
보기2: ② Reduce the air pressure of tires to improve fuel economy as much as possible.
보기3: ③ Place the insurance certificate to prepare for the submerging of a vehicle.
보기4: ④ Wipe the vehicle window with the defrost agent used during winter time.

문제: 433. Which of the following statements about potholes is correct?
보기1: ① Potholes generally form during torrential rain.
보기2: ② Driving faster will prevent tire damage from potholes.
보기3: ③ Sudden braking by larger vehicles is likely to occur near crosswalks when temperature of the road surface increases.
보기4: ④ Potholes are readily visible when the road is dry and you can just drive over them.

문제: 434. Which of the following approaches to driving in heavy rainfall is the least safe?
보기1: ① Drive with the headlights and taillights on.
보기2: ② Turn on the heater in internal air circulation mode.
보기3: ③ Check the tires for wear to prevent hydroplaning.
보기4: ④ Maintain double the usual safe distance on wet roads.

문제: 435. Which of the following is NOT an appropriate action by a driver while driving on a road during a typhoon accompanied by strong winds and heavy rain?
보기1: ① Since the brake performance decreases significantly, keep twice the usual distance from the front vehicle.
보기2: ② Upon passing the flooded area, it is better to pass without stopping.
보기3: ③ Avoid areas with high risk of flooding such as riverside and stream for parking.
보기4: ④ It is safe to park a vehicle by a wall or under a large sign.

문제: 436. Which of the following is an INCORRECT method of driving on snowy roads?
보기1: ① Just clearing the windshield of piled up snow is enough for safe driving.
보기2: ② The foot brake and engine brake must be used together.
보기3: ③ For safety, drive at 30km/h or below with snow chains on.
보기4: ④ Maintain a longer safe distance than usual.

문제: 437. Which of the following is not safe driving in rain?
보기1: ① You must reduce speed to less than half of the speed limit depending on the driving condition.
보기2: ② You must drive with reasonable consideration so as not to splash water on pedestrians.
보기3: ③ It is not good to drive in idle creep (a state where the tires move either forward or in reverse even when the accelerator and brake pedals are not applied) when it starts to rain.
보기4: ④ It is safer to drive with the headlights and daytime running lights on even during the day.

문제: 438. Which of the following is NOT a safe method to drive on a foggy road?
보기1: ① Turn on the sidelights, taillights, and headlights to indicate your position to other drivers.
보기2: ② Turn the high-beam headlights on to indicate your position to oncoming traffic.
보기3: ③ Maintain a safe distance and reduce speed.
보기4: ④ If moisture is formed on the windshield, use the wipers to secure visibility.

문제: 439. According to the Road Traffic Act, at which reduced speed should a vehicle drive on a four-lane (two lanes in each direction) motor vehicle-only road when it is wet due to rain?
보기1: ① 80km/h
보기2: ② 90km/h
보기3: ③ 72km/h
보기4: ④ 100km/h

문제: 440. Which two of the following are safe methods to drive when lightning strikes?
보기1: ① Park your vehicle under a large tree.
보기2: ② Keep windows closed and stay in the car.
보기3: ③ Keep away from the outer walls of buildings as electricity may conduct down the wet surface.
보기4: ④ Evacuate the vehicle to avoid being in it if it gets hit by lightning.

문제: 441. Which of the following is most correct about glare from other cars' headlights?
보기1: ① Glare from headlights mainly affects drivers with poor vision.
보기2: ② Glare from headlights occurs on expressways only.
보기3: ③ Blinding is primarily caused by glare from a car driving in the same direction.
보기4: ④ Frequent occurrence of blindness caused by glare is a factor that increases the risk of accidents while driving.

문제: 442. Which of the following is the right method to avoid glare caused by the headlights of an oncoming car at night?
보기1: ① Do not look directly at the headlights but at the road directly in front of your car.
보기2: ② Do not look directly at the headlights but to the right edge of the road.
보기3: ③ Squint your eyes and look at the road directly in front of your car.
보기4: ④ Squint your eyes and look to the left edge of the road.

문제: 443. Under the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is not an appropriate action on the part of a driver if the car is unable to operate due to a breakdown on the expressway at night?
보기1: ① A red flashing signal, electric lantern or spark signal that can be identified from 500 meters in all directions must be installed.
보기2: ② When installing a sign, it must be installed in a location where the driver of a vehicle approaching from the rear can see it.
보기3: ③ The driver must take necessary measures, such as moving the vehicle off the expressway.
보기4: ④ The safety tripod sign must be installed 200 meters from the point where the broken-down vehicle is located.

문제: 444. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following describes a situation in which a driver of a non-commercial vehicle is required to turn on the headlights, sidelights, taillights, and license plate lights at the same time?
보기1: ① When stopping on a road at nighttime
보기2: ② When stopping on a road with minimal visibility due to fog
보기3: ③ When the vehicle is being towed away due to a parking violation
보기4: ④ While driving inside a tunnel

문제: 445. Which of the following is the MOST appropriate action in case of vehicle failure on an expressway?
보기1: ① Turn on the emergency flashing light immediately, stop the car on the road, and notify the insurance company.
보기2: ② Open the trunk, check the broken part quickly, and call a rescue vehicle.
보기3: ③ If it is not possible to move, install a safety tripod 500 meters in front of the broken vehicle.
보기4: ④ If it is possible to move, move the vehicle to the roadside after turning on the emergency flashing light quickly.

문제: 446. Which of the following is not true about preventing a tire puncture and measures taken while driving?
보기1: ① You must regularly check the tires for nails.
보기2: ② You must regularly check tire pressures and tread depths.
보기3: ③ If the steering wheel pulls to one side, it is likely that a rear tire is punctured.
보기4: ④ You must try to maintain going straight use the compression release brake to reduce speed.

문제: 447. If your vehicle breaks down on an expressway at night, in addition to a safety tripod sign, etc. you must install road flare signals to provide visibility for ( ) and alert other motorists that your car has broken down. Choose the correct one to fill in the brackets.
보기1: ① 200 meters in every direction.
보기2: ② 300 meters in every direction.
보기3: ③ 400 meters in every direction.
보기4: ④ 500 meters in every direction.

문제: 448. Which of the following is the correct method to handle a tire that exploded while driving?
보기1: ① If the vehicle is pulled to one side suddenly, press the brakes to prevent an accident.
보기2: ② Firmly grasp the steering wheel, drive straight, and avoid sudden braking. Use the engine brake to stop in a safe location.
보기3: ③ Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is pulled in.
보기4: ④ Use the parking brake to stop the vehicle as the brake pedal won't work.

문제: 449. There has been a minor accident on a freeway. Which of the following is the proper measure that you must take in order to prevent a secondary accident?
보기1: ① First and foremost take photos of the accident for insurance purposes.
보기2: ② Explicitly let the other driver know that he/she is at fault and claim for insurance accordingly.
보기3: ③ Immediately place a warning triangle behind the damaged vehicle, move to a safe place, and call the respective authority.
보기4: ④ Turn on the hazard lights and call the respective authority inside your vehicle.

문제: 450. Which of the following is NOT a correct statement regarding the expressway construction section?
보기1: ① In the case of construction that blocks a lane, caution is required due to expected congestion.
보기2: ② In the case of a truck, drowsiness and neglect of looking forward can lead to a major accident.
보기3: ③ Various types of construction work including moving construction and stationary construction can be performed.
보기4: ④ The speed limit is set to 80 km/h.

문제: 451. Which TWO of the following measures should you take if your Hi-Pass device malfunctions and does not read correctly?
보기1: ① Turn on the emergency flashers, temporarily stop your vehicle, and have a toll ticket issued in a non-automated toll lane.
보기2: ② When you reach the toll gate of your destination, explain where you entered the expressway to the toll collector and pay the toll.
보기3: ③ Use the Hi-Pass lane and go through the toll gate of your destination, and the toll will be automatically collected.
보기4: ④ Detach the card from your Hi-Pass device at the toll gate of your destination and hand it over to the toll collector to pay the toll.

문제: 452. Which of the following is the safest action in the event of a fire in a tunnel?
보기1: ① Lock the car's doors to prevent theft and evacuate the tunnel.
보기2: ② Stay in the car as the tunnel will be filled with smoke from the fire.
보기3: ③ Switch off the engine, leave the key in the ignition to allow for the cars to be moved if necessary, and quickly evacuate to safety.
보기4: ④ Make a U-turn and drive away from the exit.

문제: 453. Which of the following is an INCORRECT approach to safety while driving through a tunnel?
보기1: ① Before entering the tunnel, remove your sunglasses to allow your eyes adapt to the light, and turn on your headlights as you would at nighttime.
보기2: ② If the lanes inside the tunnel are marked with solid white lines, do not change lanes while in the tunnel.
보기3: ③ Keep a safe following distance from the car ahead and be ready for sudden stops.
보기4: ④ Before entering the tunnel, check the road information at the entrance to the tunnel.

문제: 454. Which of the following statements about braking in an emergency situation that occurs while driving is correct?
보기1: ① If hydroplaning occurs, the braking force of the brakes gets stronger.
보기2: ② Utilizing the impact-absorbing barrier in an emergency situation is one way to prevent a fatal accident.
보기3: ③ If the road surface is wet, the vehicle always slides straight forward upon pressing the brake suddenly.
보기4: ④ The braking distance of vehicles equipped with ABS is half that of vehicles without ABS.

문제: 455. Which TWO of the following are correct safety measures to take during an earthquake?
보기1: ① Drive as quickly as possible out of the area affected by the earthquake.
보기2: ② Maintain a safe distance from other vehicles and pull over to the right-hand side of the road.
보기3: ③ Turn off the engine if you need to get out of the car to take cover.
보기4: ④ Ignore the earthquake and drive on.

문제: 456. You are driving on a freeway and there is ongoing construction ahead. Which of the following is not true? (Select two answers
보기1: ① Stay cautious when driving toward and by a construction site.
보기2: ② Drive faster than what is indicated on the construction speed limit sign.
보기3: ③ Try not to make excessive overtaking or cut in front of cars.
보기4: ④ Drive at the same speed when approaching the construction site so as not to cause unnecessary traffic disruptions.
보기5: ⑤ In areas where the speed limit changes, turn on the hazard lights to alert the other vehicles.

문제: 457. Which TWO of the following are correct measures to take when a fire starts inside a tunnel that you are driving in?
보기1: ① Turn off the engine if you are getting out of the car to evacuate.
보기2: ② Stand with your back to the wind when using a fire extinguisher.
보기3: ③ If you are unable to drive out of the tunnel, stop the car as close to the center line as possible.
보기4: ④ Take the key out of the ignition if you are getting out of the car to evacuate.

문제: 458. Which TWO of the following statements about a vehicle skid are correct?
보기1: ① Skidding mostly occurs when the brakes are applied suddenly while driving at a high speed.
보기2: ② Skidding mostly occurs when driving at a low speed in the rain.
보기3: ③ Skid marks left on a road surface do not provide any clues as to why an accident occurred.
보기4: ④ Even a vehicle with ABS can skid.

문제: 459. In which TWO of the following situations is a vehicle most likely to deviate from the road?
보기1: ① When driving on an uphill road
보기2: ② When the driver abruptly turns the steering wheel on a curved road
보기3: ③ When driving on a downhill road
보기4: ④ When the road surface is slippery

문제: 460. If the hood of the car starts generating smoke and catches fire on an expressway, which TWO of the following are the most appropriate measures to take?
보기1: ① Stop immediately when you notice that there is a problem.
보기2: ② Move to the roadside, turn off the engine, and evacuate out of the vehicle.
보기3: ③ If it is early enough to extinguish the fire, use the fire extinguisher fitted in the vehicle.
보기4: ④ If you fail to extinguish the fire, call 119 and wait right next to the vehicle.

문제: 461. In which section do the lanes start to decrease before passing the following construction section?
보기1: ① Caution section
보기2: ② Relief section
보기3: ③ Work section
보기4: ④ End section

문제: 462. Which of the following is the MOST correct description regarding driving at night?
보기1: ① It is possible to secure a wide view at night if you have the front window tinted.
보기2: ② On a clear day, the braking distance is longer during daytime than at night.
보기3: ③ It is better to secure a front view when driving at night with the fog light on rather than headlights.
보기4: ④ If you look at the light from the opposite vehicle directly, it may be hard to secure a front view due to the glare.

문제: 463. Which of the following is a correct statement about the evaporation phenomenon (cases when you are unable to see ahead due to the glare from the vehicle’s headlights) during nighttime?
보기1: ① The evaporation phenomenon will disappear if you turn off your headlights immediately when it occurs.
보기2: ② The evaporation phenomenon frequently occurs when two vehicles facing each other both have their high-beam headlights on.
보기3: ③ The evaporation phenomenon tends to occur when driving through busy downtown streets at nighttime.
보기4: ④ The evaporation phenomenon refers to the condition of momentary invisibility caused by bright lights upon entering a tunnel at nighttime.

문제: 464. Which of the following statements about a driver's ‘under aroused driving’ at nighttime is correct?
보기1: ① Cognitive ability is better than usual.
보기2: ② Eye movements become more active.
보기3: ③ It often occurs when driving on congested roads in a city.
보기4: ④ The eyes become used to a monotonous visibility and experience a type of sensory paralysis.

문제: 465. Which of the following is NOT a measure to be taken by a driver when the sun begins to set and it becomes dark?
보기1: ① Turn on the sidelights and taillights.
보기2: ② Drive slower than you would during the day.
보기3: ③ The eyes need some time to adjust to the darkness after the sun sets.
보기4: ④ Driving is easier compared to daytime driving because of greater visibility.

문제: 466. Which of the following statements regarding the electric vehicle charging cable coupler is incorrect?
보기1: ① It should have separate polarity and grounding electrode as it has a structure that cannot be replaced with other wiring equipment.
보기2: ② The grounding electrode should have a structure that is connected last when starting and separated first upon shutoff.
보기3: ③ It should have a mechanical device for locking or attachment/detachment to prevent unintended load shedding.
보기4: ④ It should have an interlock function that suspends the power supply of charging cable when the connector of an electric vehicle is separated from the connection port.

문제: 467. Which of the following is the best method to prevent vehicle fires?
보기1: ① Alter the wiring arrangement to install an amplifier in the vehicle.
보기2: ② Avoid generating static electricity while filling up in the wintertime.
보기3: ③ LPG vehicles should carry a disposable butane gas tank in preparation for an emergency.
보기4: ④ A lighter can be stored inside the vehicle in the summer.

문제: 468. Which of the following is the best method to prevent the risk of collision caused by the sudden braking of a vehicle ahead?
보기1: ① Step on the brake pedal to slow down until just before the collision.
보기2: ② Turn the steering wheel sharply to the left and drive over the center line to avoid hitting the vehicle ahead.
보기3: ③ Close your eyes to minimize the impact.
보기4: ④ Turn on both the wipers and high-beam headlights.

문제: 469. Which TWO of the following are caused by the tires of a vehicle driving at a high speed?
보기1: ① Vapor lock
보기2: ② Standing wave
보기3: ③ Fading
보기4: ④ Hydroplaning

문제: 470. Which of the following is correct regarding wearing a seat belt?
보기1: ① Fix the seat belt above the waist to protect against the shock from a traffic accident.
보기2: ② Firefighters who are dispatched to suppress fire need not wear a seat belt.
보기3: ③ It is safest for children to take the front seat and wear a seat belt.
보기4: ④ If a driver does not ensure that children under the age of 13 wear a seat belt, a fine of KRW 30,000 is imposed.

문제: 471. Which of the following should you adjust before you start driving in order to minimize injuries to the head and neck?
보기1: ① Distance of the seat from the pedals
보기2: ② Angle of the backrest
보기3: ③ Height of the headrest
보기4: ④ Seat height

문제: 472. Which of the following is correct regarding safe driving in a tunnel?
보기1: ① Turn on the left turn signal and turn left for overtaking.
보기2: ② The sense of distance from the front vehicle is reduced in a tunnel.
보기3: ③ When entering the tunnel, be careful of the light adaptation phenomenon.
보기4: ④ At the exit of a tunnel, a dark adaptation phenomenon occurs.

문제: 473. Which of the following is true about using turn signals?
보기1: ① It is not a violation to change lanes without signaling if it does not obstruct the other vehicles.
보기2: ② You must keep the turning signal on for a while after changing lanes.
보기3: ③ The penalty for a failure to signal lane change for passenger vehicles and vans is a fine of KRW 30,000.
보기4: ④ When changing lanes on a freeway, turn on the turn signal from 30 m before and keep it on until you have changed lanes.

문제: 474. In which of the following situations is a driver allowed to overtake a vehicle?
보기1: ① When the vehicle ahead is overtaking another vehicle
보기2: ② When the vehicle ahead stops or is driving slowly to prevent a dangerous situation
보기3: ③ When the vehicle ahead is driving next to another vehicle in the left lane
보기4: ④ When the vehicle ahead is driving slowly to secure a safe distance with another vehicle

문제: 475. Which of the following is correct about the speed limit of a vehicle trying to overtake another vehicle?
보기1: ① There is no speed limit applied to a vehicle overtaking another one.
보기2: ② A vehicle overtaking another vehicle can exceed the legal speed limit of the road by 50%.
보기3: ③ Vehicles are allowed to overtake other vehicles regardless of the speed limit, depending on the driver's driving skill.
보기4: ④ Overtaking other vehicles is allowed only when it is performed within the speed limit of the road.

문제: 476. Idling or parking on a freeway is prohibited as it may cause rear-end collisions. Which of the following is not true?
보기1: ① A fire truck can idle or park on a freeway to perform emergency operations.
보기2: ② You can temporarily idle or park at the instruction of a police officer or to prevent a hazardous situation.
보기3: ③ Motor vehicles can idle on the toll road to pay their tolls.
보기4: ④ Only emergency vehicles like police cars and fire trucks can idle or park at the emergency parking area inside a tunnel.

문제: 477. When you sense danger while driving and step on the brake pedal, which TWO of the following will lead to the longest stopping distance? (i. e. the distance from the point where you press the brake pedal to the point where the vehicle actually stops.)
보기1: ① Relatively light vehicle weight
보기2: ② Relatively higher speed
보기3: ③ Right after installing new tires
보기4: ④ Fatigue or drunk driving

문제: 478. Which TWO from the following is correct regarding the number of passengers in a vehicle?
보기1: ① On expressways, it is not allowed to carry more people than the defined number of passengers for the vehicle.
보기2: ② The number of passengers specified on the vehicle registration certificate is the number of passengers excluding the driver.
보기3: ③ When permission is obtained from the head of the police station having jurisdiction over the place of departure, the vehicle may operate in excess of the designated number of passengers.
보기4: ④ If the number of passengers is exceeded, permission must be obtained from the head of the police station having jurisdiction over the destination.

문제: 479. When a vehicle driving in front brakes suddenly due to a traffic accident ahead, which TWO of the following are the safest measures to avoid colliding with the vehicle?
보기1: ① Maintain a longer distance from the vehicle ahead than the stopping distance.
보기2: ② Turn on the emergency flashers and follow an emergency vehicle.
보기3: ③ Reduce speed and maintain sufficient distance with the vehicle ahead to prevent a collision.
보기4: ④ When there is any danger, use both the foot brake and parking brake to shorten the braking distance.

문제: 480. Which of the following are true about wearing seat belts? (Select two answers)
보기1: ① The penalty for a driver failing to wear a seat belt is a fine of KRW30,000.
보기2: ② Whiplash injuries are more common with two-point seat belts.
보기3: ③ The penalty for a child under the age of 13 not wearing a seat belt is a fine of KRW60,000.
보기4: ④ There are two, three, and four-point seat belts.

문제: 481. Which TWO of the following are correct about wearing a seat belt?
보기1: ① You do not have to wear a seat belt when driving to a place close by.
보기2: ② Passengers in a car should wear a seat belt for safety.
보기3: ③ It is safe to make a child sit in the passenger seat so that the parents can help the child wear a seat belt.
보기4: ④ Except when there is an emergency, the driver of an emergency vehicle should also wear a seat belt.

문제: 482. A person seems to be suffering from a fractured spine after an accident. Which of the following is the most appropriate measure you can take?
보기1: ① Check if the person is conscious and perform cardiopulmonary resuscitation immediately.
보기2: ② Move the person to a safe place and call 119.
보기3: ③ Apply the Heimlich maneuver to prevent upper airway obstruction.
보기4: ④ Unless urgent, do not move the person. If moving is inevitable, use a spine splint and assist the person in moving to a safe place.

문제: 483. When you are involved in a traffic accident, what should you do first to check if an injured person is conscious?
보기1: ① Check their pulse.
보기2: ② Try to start a conversation or gently pat their shoulders.
보기3: ③ Find the location of any wound that is bleeding heavily.
보기4: ④ Look into their mouth to check if anything is blocking their airway.

문제: 484. Which TWO vehicles from the following are allowed to continue driving while asking a passenger to take actions during a traffic accident?
보기1: ① A passenger car that is carrying an injured person to a hospital.
보기2: ② A fire truck returning to the fire station after extinguishing the fire
보기3: ③ A tow vehicle going to the scene of a traffic accident
보기4: ④ A postal service car that is carrying parcels.

문제: 485. According to the Road Traffic Act which TWO from the following are correct regarding a vehicle that is allowed to continue driving despite a traffic accident?
보기1: ① The ambulance driver who was transporting an urgent patient had the passenger take the necessary measures and kept driving.
보기2: ② The driver, who was traveling to attend an urgent meeting, had the passenger take the necessary actions and kept driving.
보기3: ③ The driver of the vehicle transporting urgent mail made the passenger take the necessary measures and kept driving.
보기4: ④ The ambulance driver, who was transporting urgent medicines, had the passengers take the necessary actions and kept driving.

문제: 486. Which of the following is not appropriate to prevent roadkills at night?
보기1: ① Reduce speed when traveling on national or mountain roads with fewer vehicles or people.
보기2: ② If you spot an animal on the road, slow down or stop on the shoulder to avoid a collision.
보기3: ③ If you spot an animal on the road, turn off the headlights and lightly sound the horn to scare it away.
보기4: ④ To more easily spot animals on the road, drive closer along the shoulder.

문제: 487. Which of the following organizations provides free towing service over a set distance in the event of an emergency?
보기1: ① Road Traffic Authority
보기2: ② Korea Expressway Corporation
보기3: ③ Police agency
보기4: ④ Korea Transportation Safety Authority

문제: 488. Which of the following is not a proper way to respond after roadkill?
보기1: ① Do not touch the animal carcass to prevent exposure to potential diseases.
보기2: ② Call any wildlife rescue center or a local government (area code + 120).
보기3: ③ Load the animal carcass on your vehicle to prevent a secondary accident.
보기4: ④ There is no need to file a report if necessary measures have been taken to prevent a secondary accident and facilitate the traffic flow.

문제: 489. Which of the following is true about anger control techniques for preventing road rage and car crashes?
보기1: ① An anger control technique that is a mindfulness-based practice designed to help you defuse stress is called the STOP technique.
보기2: ② An anger control technique during which you try to push out the negative thoughts and focus on happy thoughts for 1–2 minutes is called the time-out technique.
보기3: ③ An anger control technique during which you question yourself about the passive recognition of the belief system and distorted thoughts that trigger anger is called the reminiscence technique.
보기4: ④ An anger control technique during which you repeatedly contract and relax your arms, legs, abdomen, chest, shoulders and other body parts is called the contract-relax stretching technique.

문제: 490. Which of the following is the safest method to drive when the underground road ahead is submerged in water due to heavy rainfall?
보기1: ① Drive through slowly. You can make it as long as the wheels are not completely submerged in water.
보기2: ② Get through the water as fast as you can.
보기3: ③ Take another road to bypass the water.
보기4: ④ Drive through. If the engine stops, start it back immediately and drive through.

문제: 491. Which of the following is NOT a correct description regarding actions when responding to emergency situation such as a traffic accident?
보기1: ① Check the risk.
보기2: ② Check the response of a patient.
보기3: ③ Secure the airway and check the breathing
보기4: ④ Check the destination and identification of a patient.

문제: 492. Which of the following is NOT a correct method to handle a dangerous situation while driving?
보기1: ① Firmly grasp the steering wheel if it vibrates hard and keep driving.
보기2: ② If smoke comes out of the vehicle, pull over where it is safe and turn off the engine.
보기3: ③ If a tire explodes, hold the steering wheel firmly and pull over to a safe location.
보기4: ④ If the engine stops while crossing a railroad, evacuate the vehicle immediately and contact the authorities.

문제: 493. Which of the following are proper ways to take photographs at the scene of an accident? (Select two answers)
보기1: ① If there is a black box that successfully captured the accident, there is no need to take any photos.
보기2: ② Photos of spilled engine oil and coolant are not needed as their stains will last a long time on the road.
보기3: ③ Take photos of the overall accident scene from a distance and work your way toward the point of collision, taking photos along the way.
보기4: ④ Mark the scene by spray painting or taking photos of the direction of the tires.

문제: 494. Which TWO of the following must be inspected before starting a long-distance drive?
보기1: ① Cleanliness of the vehicle
보기2: ② DMB operation status
보기3: ③ Oils and fluids
보기4: ④ Tires

문제: 495. Which of the following constitutes a cause for revocation of a driver's license?
보기1: ① When 6 months have elapsed after the expiration date of the regular aptitude test
보기2: ② When a motorist is booked without detention for assaulting a law enforcement officer (policeman or local government official)
보기3: ③ When a motorist drives his/her car without affixing a license plate after registration
보기4: ④ When two years have elapsed without renewal of a Class II driver’s license for an ordinary motor vehicle

문제: 496. If a person notified to pay a fine fails to make the payment during the first designated period, which of the following is the correct amount the person has to pay within 20 days?
보기1: ① Original fine + 10% late penalty
보기2: ② Original fine + 20% late penalty
보기3: ③ Original fine + 30% late penalty
보기4: ④ Original fine + 40% late penalty

문제: 497. Which of the following is the correct standard for the cancellation of a driver's license based on cumulative demerit points?
보기1: ① 100+ points within 1 year
보기2: ② 191+ points within 2 years
보기3: ③ 271+ points within 3 years
보기4: ④ 301+ points within 5 years

문제: 498. Which of the following is correct regarding the standards for demerit points based on the effects of a traffic accident?
보기1: ① As for the personal injury of the driver who will receive an administrative punishment, demerit points will be given based on the rules regarding traffic accidents involving personal injury.
보기2: ② In an accident between a car and a pedestrian, demerit points will not be given if the accident occurred due to both parties committing mistakes.
보기3: ③ If the accident was unavoidable or had been caused clearly by a mistake of the injured, demerit points will be halved.
보기4: ④ In an accident between cars, demerit points are given only to the driver who committed a serious violation that caused the accident.

문제: 499. Which of the following statements regarding the penalty for parking violations is correct?
보기1: ① The owner of a passenger car involved in a parking violation should pay a fine of KRW 30,000.
보기2: ② The owner of a van involved in a parking violation should pay a fine of KRW 70,000.
보기3: ③ No penalty is given even if you do not pay the fine during the designated period.
보기4: ④ For parking violations that continue for more than two hours at the same location, additional fines are imposed.

문제: 500. Which of the following is a scenario in which the Act on Special Cases Concerning the Settlement of Traffic Accidents is applied because the driver who caused the accident has comprehensive insurance or is insured through a mutual aid association?
보기1: ① When the driver has violated his/her duty to drive safely, resulting in car damage or a minor accident
보기2: ② When the driver has caused an accident that resulted in loss of human life
보기3: ③ When the driver has fled the scene after causing an accident, without attending to the injured
보기4: ④ When the driver has violated traffic signals, causing an accident involving minor injuries

문제: 501. 7 acquaintances split up into 4 different vehicles and caused harm to others on the road; they were pressed for criminal charges. Which of the following punishment criteria is incorrect?
보기1: ① Up to 2 years' imprisonment or fine of up to KRW 5 million
보기2: ② Up to 3 years' imprisonment or fine of up to KRW 10 million
보기3: ③ Driver's license cancellation if the driver is detained.
보기4: ④ Demerit of 40 points in case of criminal charges

문제: 502. The driver of an automobile is arrested for reckless driving. Which of the following is the correct administrative disposition of the driver’s license?
보기1: ① Revocation of the driver’s license
보기2: ② 100-day suspension of the driver’s license
보기3: ③ 60-day suspension of the driver’s license
보기4: ④ 40-day suspension of the driver’s license

문제: 503. According to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, what is the punishment for riding a bicycle while intoxicated?
보기1: ① No punishment
보기2: ② Notification of a minor offense penalty of KRW 30,000
보기3: ③ Punished through an administrative fine of KRW 40,000
보기4: ④ Punished through an administrative fine not exceeding KRW 100,000 or by detention

문제: 504. According to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, what is the action taken if a bicycle rider, who has considerable reason to be suspected of being intoxicated, refuses a police officer’s demand for a breathalyzer test?
보기1: ① No punishment
보기2: ② Punished through an administrative fine of KRW 70,000
보기3: ③ Notification through a minor offense penalty of KRW 100,000
보기4: ④ Punished through an administrative fine not exceeding KRW 100,000 or by detention

문제: 505. Which TWO of the following situations are subject to criminal prosecution in accordance with the Act on Special Cases Concerning the Settlement of Traffic Accidents?
보기1: ① A driver without comprehensive insurance reaches a settlement with the victim after causing an accident resulting in property damage.
보기2: ② A taxi driver who is a member of the Taxi Mutual Aid Association causes a traffic accident resulting in injury or death after driving over the center line.
보기3: ③ A driver with comprehensive insurance causes a traffic accident resulting in injury or death after committing a violation of traffic signal.
보기4: ④ A freight vehicle driver who is a member of the Trucking Association causes a traffic accident resulting in property damage after failing to drive safely.

문제: 506. You fail to pay a fine, for which you have been notified in writing, even by its second deadline. Which TWO of the following are applicable?
보기1: ① You must request a summary judgment immediately.
보기2: ② Your license will be suspended for 40 days if no summary judgment is reached.
보기3: ③ A penalty will be charged.
보기4: ④ No summary judgment needs to be requested if you pay the fine along with an additional 30% as a delay penalty.

문제: 507. According to Road Traffic Act what punishment is imposed when a driver causes a traffic accident that harms vehicles parked or stopped and does not provide his/her personal information to the victim(s)?
보기1: ① No punishment
보기2: ② Impose penalty of KRW 100,000.
보기3: ③ Notify penalty of KRW 120,000.
보기4: ④ Impose fine of up to KRW 300,000 or detention.

문제: 508. Which of the following is the correct punishment criterion for anyone driving while intoxicated with a blood alcohol content of 0.03% or more and less than 0.08%? (In the case of a first-time violation)
보기1: ① Imprisonment up to 1 year or a fine up to KRW 5 million
보기2: ② Imprisonment up to 2 years or a fine up to KRW 10 million
보기3: ③ Imprisonment up to 3 years or a fine up to KRW 15 million
보기4: ④ Imprisonment in the range of 2 years - 5 years or a fine of KRW 10 million or more (up to KRW 20 million)

문제: 509. Your appeal regarding the administrative action against your driver’s license has been accepted. Which of the following is the correct reduction applicable to the revocation of your license?
보기1: ① 90 demerit points
보기2: ② 100 demerit points
보기3: ③ 110 demerit points
보기4: ④ 120 demerit points

문제: 510. If a driver with a student license drives in an inebriated state with a blood alcohol content not less than ( ) percent, his/her student license shall be revoked. Which answer fits in ( )?
511. Which of the following is the punishment imposed on a driver who has been criminally charged for assaulting a traffic police officer?
보기1: ① 40 demerit points
보기2: ② 100 demerit points
보기3: ③ Revocation of the driver’s license
보기4: ④ Request for a summary trial

문제: 512. Each time a driver (if not a victim of a traffic accident) arrests or reports to arrest a driver of a vehicle that has caused a traffic accident involving personal injury and fled, a benefit of ( ) shall be given. What is true of ( )
보기1: ① 10 points
보기2: ② 20 points
보기3: ③ 30 points
보기4: ④ 40 points

문제: 513. Which of the following is an incorrect pairing of fines and violations by the driver of a passenger car?
보기1: ① KRW 120,000 for a speed violation (Exceeding 60 kilometers per hour)
보기2: ② KRW 60,000 for a signal violation
보기3: ③ KRW 60,000 for driving over the center line
보기4: ④ KRW 50,000 for violation of the period or place in which overtaking is prohibited

문제: 514. According to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, what is the fine imposed on the driver of a passenger car parked within 5 meters of the transmission valve of a fire department standpipe used for fire extinguishing purposes?
보기1: ① KRW 40,000
보기2: ② KRW 30,000
보기3: ③ KRW 20,000
보기4: ④ No fine is imposed.

문제: 515. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following violations involves a different criterion for demerit points?
보기1: ① Driving while neglecting disorderly conduct by a passenger inside the vehicle
보기2: ② Violating the method of passing a railroad crossing
보기3: ③ Violation of passage on a roadside in an expressway
보기4: ④ Violation of the exclusive lane for buses on an expressway

문제: 516. When a driver subject to a summary judgment pays the total sum of the due fine in addition to ( ) of the fine and submits a document confirming the payment before the announcement of the summary judgment, the police chief is required to cancel the summary judgment on the driver. Select one of the following to fill in the brackets.

517. Which of the following is the correct punishment criteria if the driver of an automobile refuses a police officer’s legitimate demand for a breathalyzer test in a situation where the police officer has considerable reason to suspect that the driver is intoxicated?
보기1: ① Imprisonment for not less than one year but no more than two years, or a fine up to KRW 5 million
보기2: ② Imprisonment for not less than one year but no more than three years, or a fine up to KRW 10 million
보기3: ③ Imprisonment for not less than one year but no more than four years, or a fine in the range of KRW 5 million - KRW 10 million
보기4: ④ Imprisonment for not less than one year but no more than five years or a fine in the range of KRW 5 million - KRW 20 million

문제: 518. Which of the following vehicles attracts a different fine compared to the others when its driver commits a violation of traffic signal?
보기1: ① Van
보기2: ② Passenger car
보기3: ③ Special vehicle
보기4: ④ Construction equipment

문제: 519. The driver of a vehicle is traveling on an expressway without carrying a vehicle breakdown sign (safety tripod sign) inside the vehicle. What will happen?
보기1: ① A fine of KRW 20,000 will be charged.
보기2: ② The driver will be imposed with a fine of KRW 20,000.
보기3: ③ A fine of up to KRW 300,000 will be charged.
보기4: ④ No fine or penalty will be imposed.

문제: 520. Which of the following is the correct pairing of fine and speed range imposed on the driver of a passenger car caught speeding on an expressway?
보기1: ① For exceeding the speed limit by over 60 km/h to 80 km/h
보기2: ② For exceeding the speed limit by over 40 to 60 km/h
보기3: ③ For exceeding the speed limit by over 20 to 40 km/h
보기4: ④ For exceeding the speed limit by below 20 km/h

문제: 521. Which of the following is the correct statement regarding the demerit points applied to a driver who causes an accident?
보기1: ① When a traffic accident occurs in which one death (within 72 hours) is caused due to the violation of a signal, a penalty of 105 demerit points is incurred.
보기2: ② Demerit points are also applied for losses that passengers of the victim's vehicle and the driver of the offending vehicle suffered.
보기3: ③ Demerit points are calculated based on the cause of the accident, any casualties, and damage to property.
보기4: ④ If the accident involves two vehicles, no demerit points are applied if both vehicles are responsible for the accident.

문제: 522. According to Road Traffic Act the medical checkup result report that determines whether a driver is eligible for an aptitude test or not should be the document issued within ( ) from the driver's license application date. Which of the following is correct?
보기1: ① 1 year
보기2: ② 2 years
보기3: ③ 3 years
보기4: ④ 4 years

문제: 523. In accordance with the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, if you object to the revocation of your driver's license, when can you submit an application to the Objections Deliberation Committee of the Metropolitan Police?
보기1: ① Within 90 days of the revocation
보기2: ② Within 90 days of becoming aware of the revocation
보기3: ③ Within 60 days of the revocation
보기4: ④ Within 60 days of becoming aware of the revocation
